name: Timberland Men's White Ledge Mid Waterproof Ankle Boot

reviews.review_text: I needed a pair of hiking boots to replace the Keene boots that were only 1 1/2 yrs old but not only lost their waterproofing in the first six months but had a weed stalk in the field go right through the side and almost break my skin. This was the second pair of Keene’s that had gone bad in just over a year and, at $130 I was getting tired of replacing them. Started looking at reviews and found these. They have a large toe box with plenty of room. Before I took them out I took another reviewers advice and put a coating of Mink Oil on them. They were comfortable but I knew they’d take a little break in. I now have about three or four miles of walking through the fields and surprisingly they seem to be breaking in rather quickly. I usually put on about 500-700 miles a year. One note, if you’re looking for hiking boots that will give you really good ankle support these ARE NOT for you, look elsewhere. These are for easy hiking, fields and roadway. When I got them I first put in a pair of Dr. Scholls and that went a long way toward making them immediately comfortable. If I remember I’ll give an update in three or four months. UPDATE: Jan. 6, 2018 - I’ve now had a chance to wear these for a while including the recent snow storm and frigid temps (at least for us). We got 5” of snow, temps this morning, when I took the dog out, we’re 4 or 5 degrees with a windchill of -8. I had been wearing wool socks with these and my feet have stayed warm and dry on a 25 to 35 min. walk through the fields. This time, with the snow and frigid windchill I decided to try just summer cotton socks. Bear in mind I’m a 70 year old with diabetes, which does affect circulation, so I’m pretty sensitive to cold and heat and the comfort of my foot wear. (I walk approximately 3 miles a day with my dog, even in the snow and cold unless it’s too much for her.) So, the results of a 20 minute walk were still warm and dry feet. I could have gone much further but Harley was getting snow turning to ice between her toes every few minutes and we’d have to stop and I’d have to remove it. Bottom line: When I received these boots I put in my Dr. Scholls insoles from my previous pair, rubbed in three coats of mink oil on dry days (which I think was key to waterproofing) and started walking. I’ve found them to be far more comfortable than the Keen’s I was previously wearing. I don’t walk as much as a lot of people, about 25 miles a week, but they’re doing well for me for field and neighborhood walking. 2/9/18: I like to keep folks updated on important stuff: If you want a pair of boots to wear, every day, and forget when you take them off, look elsewhere. Because these are leather they require a LOT of care. If they get soaking wet do NOT continue to wear them the next day, you’ll ruin them. I’ve found that when mine get soaked from walking in the pouring rain, in the field with my dog, I wipe them clean with an old towel, put shoe trees in them to keep the leather from shrinking and set them aside where there’s a flow of air to let them air dry. Do not try and force dry them with hot air, you’ll ruin the leather. Putting them a few feet away from a fan seems to work okay or just let them sit. While they’re drying I use an old pair that I kept. After they have dried completely I retreat every inch of leather, paying particular attention to seams and around grommets, with mink oil, let it sit and dry then retreat again. Is the above a pain? Yes it is but these appear to be quality boots and you need to take care of them, not let them get muddy and wet and toss them in the corner for the next day.
reviews.review_header: Just got them, have about three miles on them....UPDATED 2/9 ..

reviews.review_text: I have an old & new pair of identical style/size boots. The 5 year old pair were and still are very comfortable all day on concrete floor, no break-in required. Except for a couple of quick-lace eyelet failures, the old pair have stayed together & decently waterproof. They were made in Vietnam. The new pair, again same size & style were made in China. After wearing less than an hour the inside of by heels began to burn and on the way to blistering. I compared dial caliper measurements of the heel width & found the Chinese model heel 1/8" more narrow than the old pair & explains a correspondingly smaller upper. Outsourcing to the cheapest manufacturer isn't always the best option if you want to maintain your reputation. If I wanted cheap, there's a wally world on every corner, same boot at half price, minus the label. But hey, they cut that corner too, no Timberland embroidery stitching in the tongue! Anything to save a buck! Disappointed...

Very nice boot, seemingly well made and tough. I added an aftermarket padded insole and was immediately able to walk over 7 miles, three days in a row without a break-in period. HOWEVER, after just my fourth day of wearing these boots one of the riveted eyelets on the left boot broke and came out of the leather hole, so now I have to take it to shoe repair to get fixed (hopefully). If they can't fix it reasonably I'm sending them back. A shame because these are very comfortable boots. I should not have to pay for a repair because of shoddy craftsmanship. I'll revise the review as this issue progresses.

I recently purchased these boots and I must say they are very comfortable and seems well built. I ordered a 9.5 and they are true to size any smaller they would be too tight any bigger they would have too much space. Prime shipping came on time as expected and I would order again!

I want to preface this review by saying I do not usually review items unless I am extremely impressed either positively or negatively. For the Timberland White Ledge boots the feeling is the latter. These boots might be ok for a casual hike or two but CAN NOT hold up to daily repetitive use. I purchased these boots on Nov 8th 2017 for daily use at work, I am on my feet 8 hours a day walking and interacting with customers and wanted something a little more supportive than "running shoes" In that area these boots are great, comfortable, supportive and my feet were not sore or tired at the end of a day. But after less than 2 weeks of use the front toe area where the leather upper meets the thicker rubber part of the sole started to separate. Within 4 weeks the boots were completely unusable due to the worsening of the separation. Thinking I might have gotten a pair with weak glue, I purchased another pair but after 2 weeks the new pair is also doing the same. This is happening on both feet with daily use, just walking, I am not in construction or hiking on rough rocks yet the toe area can not stay together. I have heard Timberland has a 1-year warranty if the boots fail during normal use but considering this has happened to two pairs both within a month of daily use I would not recommend unless you potentially want to be replacing your boots every month.
reviews.review_header: Toe area can not hold up to daily use.

name: Refresh WYNNE-01 Women's combat style lace up ankle bootie

reviews.review_text: Love the look and style of these! But when I put them on the first and only time there was a nail sticking up through them. Bummer! Highly recommend checking the inside before putting foot in them! hoping to hear back soon how this is going to be resolved.

These are the BEST pair of shoes I have ever purchased! I get compliments EVERYWHERE I go, even from strangers on the street! They are so durable and really good quality! I even wore them in the snow by unfolding them and tying them all the way up and not a single snowflake got it (and I'm talking 10inches of snow) seriously incredible. Don't hesitate! You won't regret it! I wear mine almost every day!
reviews.review_header: Best pair of shoes I haver ever bought

reviews.review_text: Boots arrived timely, looked great, and fit as expected. My daughter went to put them on and .... "Ouch!" A sharp shoe tack was found to be sticking up right through the insole! This was almost a bloody disaster ... but she felt the sting and removed her foot before pushing the boot on further. With a little ingenuity and a few tools I was able to clip off the sharp point and pound down the hazard. I know this seller allows for returns but my daughter wanted to wear them that night, so I figured I'd suck it up and fix them myself. But overall, I'm sure this one little mistake is not common, and the boots got lots of nice comments from her friends. So I give the boots 1 star for nearly injuring my kid, but 5 stars for style - so that averages out to my rating of a 3 stars.
reviews.review_header: Great Style, Well Made - except for one dangerous tack!

reviews.review_text: These are very good looking & a nice quality for under $30. I bought the tan & the taupe. I was going to decide between them and send one pair back. I prefer the taupe color but I really like both so I am going to keep both pair. I just might get a pair in black too. Its true that there is no arch support, but i'm flat-footed and high arches hurt my feet. I definitely prefer a flatter sole, so no problem there....the foot-bed is not cushioned and I thought that might hurt my feet, but I wore medium-thickness cushioned socks and walked around campus quite a bit today with no discomfort at all. I have picky feet that get sore easily so I was pleasantly surprised. I saw that a few reviewers had an issue with nails sticking up out of the foot-bed (eek!) so I made sure to check carefully before sticking my feet in. No nails in either pair---phew!....The only flaw that I found is that one of the snaps of the folded cuff (taupe color, inner part of the right shoe) will not stay snapped. It seems to be mis-positioned and pops open every time I try to snap it. But this isn't a problem for me because you can't even tell. The folded part stays down just fine without the snaps. My boot size is usually anywhere from 7-8 because sizing can be so inconsistent from brand to brand. I have a few pair of Sorel boots (in the old-school whole sizes they used prior to coming out with the 1/2 sizes) that are a U.S. women's size 7, but my normal running/trainer shoe size is a U.S. women's 8 (in new balance, asics & Sanuk brands). I decided to go with size 8 for these boots and i'm glad I did. They fit perfectly. There is enough room for thicker socks without feeling like my feet are squeezed in, but I also tried them on at home with thinner socks & they don't slip or feel too big. They really do fit perfectly for me. :)
Love the look and fit but after only 3 days of wearing them I noticed That the shoes are already separating from the soles! Not happy..
I LOVE THESE SHOES! They fit perfect, they're so warm and they don't hurt my feet. I don't think I've ever been happier with a pair of shoes in my life..

If you're considering buying these, stop considering. BUY THEM. They are true to size, they are warm, the color looks the same as in the photo, and they are great quality; I am infatuated with these boots. You will not regret this purchase!

The shoe fits as to be expected but a bit narrow. However, the very first time I wore them and kneeled down to pick up my baby, the toe had a big spot of brown paint come off. There is a big, visible grey spot of the underneath now. I contacted the seller but in almost two months I still have no resolution. It's been about a month since the last time I got any sort of response from them.

name: Columbia Women's Minx Mid II Omni-Heat Winter Boot

reviews.review_text: When I buy shoes I look for a totally flat shoe (zero drop), flexible (lets my foot be a foot), no toe spring (shortens top of the foot) and most important to me is a wide toe box so my toes don't get squished (leading to bunions and pronation). Rarely can I find all four qualities unless I buy minimalist shoes, but then I won't get the good traction or warmth in the winter. These Columbia Minx offer warmth and traction, but the insole has about an inch high! The ball of the foot is about 1/4 inch, so my heel is elevated about the ball of my foot by 3/4 of an inch. If you take out the insole, these appear to be zero drop. They’re flexible even with the shoe liner and from what my friend who owns a pair says they get more flexible over time, which is a plus for me. There is a little toe spring (seems tough to avoid in most shoes). I can fit my feet in the boot while wearing my Correct Toes™ without squishing my feet, but just barely. They have just the right amount of room without the liners. Check out how they measure up to the shoe liner test (see below); I’m spilling over the edge a bit. Ideally, your foot should not spill over the edge of the liner. For reference, the widest part of my foot is 4 inches and I ordered the size 8 boot. I might return them for an 8 1/2 and replace the shoe liner with a flat one. I wish these were sold in wide or did not have a tapered toe. Pros: Warm (-25 degrees F), flexible, waterproof and zero drop without the liners, light, good traction. Cons: elevated heel toe liner, a tad narrow, has a toe spring.
reviews.review_header: Many positives, but wish they were a tad wider and had flatter insoles.

reviews.review_text: I have worn them 3 times (super comfortable) but THEY ARE NOT WATERPROOF!!!! The left shoe somewhere on the side is leaking. All 3 times I have put them on inside, walked down the driveway with my dog in the rain to the park (200m away) the grass is wet but they shoes are not submerged... is Australian grass and rain just so hardcore that Columbia Footwear can't stand up to it? Super disappointed because I bought them purely for the waterproof / flexible sole / comfort feature. Love them and hate them.
reviews.review_header: Super disappointed because I bought them purely for the waterproof ...

reviews.review_text: These are great winter boots! I live in Northwest Indiana so good winter boots are a must! They are very warm, so far I have not felt the slightest bit cold! Have worn them for hours in the snow! I did however order them in a half size bigger than my usual and had to return them for another half size larger. So I would suggest ordering a whole size up! If you like to wear think socks maybe order a size and a half larger! Otherwise they look and feel great and are water proof! *UPDATE ON THE BOOTS*************** These are cute boots, extremely comfortable and warm BUT they are not at all water proof. I would not count on them if you plan to be getting your boots wet. They can be pretty slick on icy pavement as well.
reviews.review_header: Great boots! Waterproof and warm/ not water proof

reviews.review_text: I bought these for my vacation to Iceland, and they were excellent! I am a Texas girl who is not used to snow and cold weather but do love it. I followed everyone's advice and sized up. I wear a 7 in sandals and flats and a 7.5 in boots and sneakers so I can wear socks. I had to order a size 8 in these which was perfect. I first went to Boston where I was out in windy 13 degree conditions, and they were so comfortable. My feet never got cold although I also had Hot Hand toe warmers on. Iceland had 30 degree temperatures and they were fine. They are so cushioned (kinda like memory foam) and were able to be used right out of the box. I never wore them before I packed them in my suitcase because I got them the day before I left on my trip. I walked through snow and puddles and they held up very well. I am looking to buy the shorty version now. I will definitely take these to any winter trips I have in the future.
reviews.review_header: I could walk in these for days! Size Up

reviews.review_text: I am writing this in the hope that it will help someone else. I shopped around a good deal for a warm, light boot. I was tired of big, heavy winter boots that I cannot drive in and that take a long time to put on. These are wonderful and I LOVE them. They are like wearing slippers. I can slip them on and off in a second. I sized up a half size to wear wool socks underneath and it is just right. With wool socks my feet actually get hot and I live in a COLD place. I wear them to walk my dogs and run errands, so no I have not done anything such as backpacking or standing outside all day, but for my needs they are perfect. Also, I decided to order despite people saying that they are not waterproof. Having grown up in the midwest I don't know how anyone could expect a fabric boot to be entirely waterproof. For wet and slush you would need something else--a big rubbery boot, likely. The advantage of this is it's light as air and really comfy. It feels like a moccasin. This is better for drier conditions such as when it is very cold. My two cents.
reviews.review_header: I shopped around a good deal for a warm

reviews.review_text: These are just sort of Mehhh boots. At an original price of $130, I expect them to be ridiculously amazing. Paying $80, I still expect them to be amazing. They are just sort of "okay". Not as cute as I'd hoped and nowhere near as warm as I had hoped. All the reviews I read said size up a whole size, I disagree. I wear a 7.5 or 8 depending on the shoe, and I always buy a 9 in running shoes to give my feet room to swell on runs. So I figured a 9 in these would be fine, especially since everyone said they run so small. They are way too big! My left foot is a bit smaller than my right, so I'm used to the left shoe always feeling a tad bit loose, however, strangely, the left fits fine and the right is huge, my heel slips in it. If I put on an extra thick pair of socks it helps, but I think sizing up only a half size would be plenty. As for warmth, I was used to wearing a pair of Rockies hunting boots that were so insulated I could slip my bare feet in them and run around in -15 temps and still have toasty warm toes (sadly the soles started to separate and I had to break down and get new boots. I tried to get cute AND warm, but I guess you really can't have the best of both worlds.) This morning I put these boots on over my nylons and headed out into the roughly 10 degree morning. While not freezing, my feet were definitely chilly. So I'm not buying the -25 degree rating they come with. So, if you get a killer deal, sure, buy them. If you are looking for cute, eh, they're okay. If you're looking for super warm, look elsewhere.

name: Dr. Martens Women's Pascal Leather Combat Boot

reviews.review_text: I ordered both the Pascals and the 1460s (from another store) for my daughter (age 17) to compare, assuming we would return one. The difference in the details are: The Pascals leather is softer, with a slight pebbly finish, and the top (around your ankle) is a tiny bit shorter, and the leather is just cut off - making it more pliable, so it doesn't rub your ankle/leg. The 1460s are a stiffer leather with a smoother, shinier finish, and have a sewn hem type edging along the top. When she wore the 1460s she noticed two things. The top edging rubbed her leg just above the ankle, and her heel slipped and rubbed painfully where the heel cup and shaft join - right on her achilles. The size on the Pascals were comparable to the 1460s, but the Pascals were a tiny bit narrower, and more compact, making them look slightly more refined (not as combat looking). She liked both shoes, but chose the Pascals for three reasons - no painful break-in period; finish of the leather; and it was easier to return the 1460's purchased at a local store (rather than shipping back to Amazon seller). Hope this helps if you are trying to decide....

I want to leave a solid review here because it took me some time to purchase these and I read numerous reviews prior to. Sizing is confusing, I wear an 8.5 womens. I went with the 8W (not to be confused with Wide, the W stands for womens). I sized down because I didn't want extra room in my boot. I tend to prefer my shoes on the tighter side, plus I was concerned the extra room would cause blisters from friction and movement (as my Frye boots did when I ordered a size up). These boots are BEAUTIFUL. Exactly as I remembered from my pair I owned in high school. They fit tight on first wear, especially where the tongue meets the boot (the seam). So I wore wet wool socks for 3 hours in them to soften em up and form them to my feet. My left foot a slightly bigger than my right so this shoe fits tighter but not horribly uncomfortable at all. I wore them with regular socks last night for 5 hours and they fit AWESOME already. No discomfort at all. Super fast and easy to break in when it comes to a leather boot. My Fryes took months to break in and quite honestly, they still aren't nearly as comfortable at these. I'd feel confident wearing these all day or to walk around in alot. LOVE LOVE THEM.
reviews.review_header: Read here to help with sizing!

reviews.review_text: These are my second pair of Pascals, absolutely the best purchase in way of online shoe shopping. The Pascals are a much softer leather and do not cut into the top of your ankles as the 1480's tend to when breaking in. A much tighter fit when lacing it up as well which I appreciate since I have narrower feet. The heel and tip of shoes are very sturdy and not soft like the top half which is wonderful for its durability. I plan on getting a pair in every color that's how much I loves these! *I am a true 8.5 and I would recommend if you are a 8 or 8.5 to get these for sure. I originally got a pair of 9's which did not fit in the least, go smaller since they are very roomy.

I had tried it on at a Dr. Martens store before buying it online. Amazon had a better price for my size. I was going to buy the gothic purple color, but after seeing it was more gray, I decided to get the red one. I had a cobbler stretch them out for me, not because they were tight, but because they were stiff. They will need a little more breaking in, but it will not be as painful as going through the whole process on your own. I am usually a US size 8 in flats, and 8.5 in sneakers and boots to accomodate the thicker socks.I have slender feet, and my feet were swimming in my regular size size 8, even with the thick socks I wore the day I tried them on. The staff at the store said I should size down to UK size 5. Your feet will hurt, and it will be a pain to break them in. Just be patient. Go to a shoe repair shop, and let them stretch it out for you. It's an investment, the last pair I owned, a unisex 1460, lasted 10 years before they finally gave in, and my local cobbler advised me to donate them.
reviews.review_header: Visit a cobbler to help break it in

reviews.review_text: I wore docs in the 1990s & loved them. Then last month I needed new shoes. These were a little more narrow than I hoped but they are soft leather so I figured I'd try them. The top is really soft and doesn't run against your leg at all. I bought these and wore them around the house on the carpet for a day or so to make sure they'd work. After I committed to keeping them I waxed them since I was traveling to a snowy, wet region. I wore them as much as I could for 3-4 days and by then they finally felt like they fit. I've had them for two weeks now, and I'm stoked. Haven't had a pair in over two decades & I'm glad to have a new pair now.
reviews.review_header: I wore docs in the 1990s & loved them. Then last month I needed new shoes

reviews.review_text: I have wanted red Docs since the first time I saw them. I'm glad I FINALLY threw caution to the wind and just ordered them! I've gotten a few pairs of Docs in the past that never really fit right -- I was going by the fit guide on the websites that say if you normally wear a size 8 in U.S. shoes, you should order a size 6 in U.K. shoes. What the size guides don't tell you (and honestly, how could they know?) is that if you wear a size 8 in CHEAP SHOES you probably really only wear a size 7 in GOOD SHOES. At least that's what I've decided. This time I ordered the size 5 in the red Docs and prayed I wasn't making a mistake and would have to return them. When they arrived I put them on and yowza -- they fit great! No more heel-slippage, no more futzing with a variety of shoe inserts and bulky socks, just sheer wonderfulness. To be totally honest, I did have to do a little stretching on the right shoe, but that's because my right foot has always been a little bit bigger than my left. A lot of people have asked Doc Martens to offer half-sizes and I agree, but meanwhile some shoe balm and one of those shoe-stretch thingies works too.

I love them! Much nicer than originals, which are so stiff that sometimes they look like rubber boots. Leather on these is soft, and i had no breaking in period at all. I live in Arizona, so i put some Dr. Martens balm on my brand new boots, put them on, and sat down in full sun in my back yard for 20 minutes. I got up, walked around the pool for few minutes, and that was it. Great boots, i just got a pair in Ivory as well!

name: CLPP'LI Womens Twin Button Fully Fur Lined Waterproof Winter Snow Boots

reviews.review_text: I wear a size 8 and a 1/2. Because of the reviews, I ordered a size 9 in grey. I thought they would be to big. But the fit is great. I'll see how warm they will be in the cold. Thinking not warm at all. But I can put on thick socks. But besides that, I'm thinking of buying them in a different color. I like them a lot for a throw on and go boot. Well, I was right about them not being warm. We haven't had but very little snow so far. But the weather is cold and so we're my toes. But I just love the feeling and look of these boots. You can fold down the top to a bootie boot. They are just so cute. I wore them only once and already got a compliment on them. Well now we have been dumped on with lots of snow. I have found out that the boots not only do not keep your feet warm, but they are not waterproof. If you purchase these boots, don't forget to purchase some waterproof spray. But overall the boots are so cute and soft to ware. Just remember to order one size bigger. Hope this review is very helpful because I really trust the reviews before I ordered online.

When I received these and tried them on, I was going to return them because they felt too tight. But then I tried them again, and after the "fur" lining settled down a little, they were absolutely perfect. I have to mention that for most of my life, I've worn size 9 shoes, but in the past few years I've bought size 10, because my feet have apparently expanded. So I bought these in a size 10. They are easy to put on and take off, and I often wear them all day. I'm not sure if they have an actual arch support, but the thick lining makes my feet comfortable anyway. The price was excellent, too. They seem to be pretty well waterproof, but if I walk through a mud puddle, the dirt sticks to them and I have to brush it off when it dries - it doesn't slide off like it would on a really waterproof boot. But I haven't put any waterproofing spray on them either (another money saver). They're a great investment, and I highly recommend them.

I just received my boots today, and I tried them on with regular socks that are not thick, and the boots were a bit snug, enough I that I know with thick socks on that wouldn't work for me. The only reason I got these is because I am pregnant and will be delivering in March, and these were the only boots I could find that have a decent bottom on the boot, so the risk of slipping is not as bad. As far as quality goes, they are a bit off, there was a stitch the outer side of the boot where the shaft and the foot part meet, that some of the fur is stick up, the other boot isn't like that though, it's got the additional stitch needed. Now if these had fit like they should have, I would have just added the additional stitches my self. For the price and the feel of he boot, I really do like them a lot, and when my replacement pair gets here, I plan on wearing them a lot. :-) I give 5 stars to Amazon customer service because they were awesome when I called, because I knew I needed to order a size up. They were very easy to work with and very understanding. So my suggestion is if your foot is usually a half size in boots, you should consider going up to the next size in these. I didn't at first cause I was nervous that they would be too big. However after looking at the size of the boots that I received today, I know that they run smaller than the size they say.

These boots are cute, super comfy and very light weight (but still warm and cozy). B/c others said they run small, I ordered a size larger (I wear 7 and I ordered 8), but they are still way too small for me. Too snug even with bare feet, and I definitely couldn't wear socks with them. Love the boots though so I'm going to exchange them for size 9. I have fairly narrow feet so the width is not an issue, the boots are just unusually small - or the sizes are mislabeled. What the seller claims is size 8, in reality is size 7. Other than that, these are great, soft, fuzzy boots :) I'm taking off one star b/c of the sizing issue.

I never expect that the size will be fit as I am not expected from. They said that should order plus another half size. And when I was given the opportunity to receive the product at discounted price in return of my honest opinion and review. I was so skeptical that I did not order the 7 1/2 since I am on size 7 BUT when i received the Clpp'li Womens Twin Button Fully Fur Lined Waterproof Winter Snow Boots, all I said is just WOW. Fits perfect for me. No flaws at all. I like the idea that you can fold the boots. This is my first time seeing folding boots lol but hey look so cute and so adorable. I choose gray because I still dont have a gray one. And The moment you receive it you gonna think why the box are small lol and when I opened it I just realized that the boots can be folded. The moment you gonna try it you can say so fantastic because it is really soft inside. And very warm and having a thick fur. Very well made and have a high quality standards. I do highly recommended the boots. Will do the more updates as soon the winter starts to comes off.

Really like this boot. It is very warm and comfortable to wear-no break in needed. I originally purchased this for the cheap cost and because my feet have swelled up with pregnancy. These boots open up easily with their elastic button closure and make swelling a non-issue. I do love that the bottoms have great grip-a must when you’re especially wary of falling. The boots did come with a bit of a smell, but a few days of airing out solved that. Overall good purchase, especially for the price.
reviews.review_header: Good alternative to expensive name brands

name: DailyShoes Women's Military Combat Lace up Mid Calf High Credit Card Knife Money Wallet Pocket Boots

reviews.review_text: I am IN LOVE with my new boots!! I was so worried they wouldn't fit but I risked it and ordered my actual size which is 5.5 and they fit PERFECTLY! I was also worried after reading some reviews about the zipper getting stuck so I tested mine and it DID but there is a reason for it I bet none of the other people noticed. They actually made them to stop about halfway down. Why? I don't know. But you can easily see the stitch across the zipper to stop it from going down further. I added a picture of it. So that is NOT a stuck zipper or a mistake in manufacturing as both my boots are like that. It opens plenty enough to put in my cards and keys. Anyways, I can't give a good enough review for these. I'm going to wear them everywhere no matter how hot it is. Buy these if you're a boot lover you will NOT regret it!!!

I'm very, very sorry I put these boots on directly out of the box as soon as they came to my house because I am never taking them off ever again. Everything about them is absolutely perfect. I got the ones in chocolate brown and the color is a nice, dark buff. The laces are cord-style, but not stiff in any way and very easy to tie and adjust. I won't be using them much, though, because the zippers down the inside are more than adequate for getting me into and out of the boot. I'm considering replacing them with lace, because "combat boot" is only the style, not the attitude. These would look *adorable* with white lace laces. As for the pockets, the zippers only go about halfway down, but the pocket only goes that far, so it isn't a functional issue. A perk of that same function, however, is that above the ankle the boot is wide and supple, allowing both for a good range of movement while wearing the boot and a pocket deep enough to hold cards, cash, and even a key or two. Another thing I love about these boots is that they're substantial, but they don't make my feet look big. I'm a tall woman, and I have relatively large feet. The narrow sole, blunted toe, and wide ankle give the boots all the "boot-itude" a combat boot should have without exaggerating the size of my actual foot. These boots are functional, comfortable, and they make my feet look cute. That's as close to "life-changing" as a pair of shoes gets. :-) 10/10 would buy again

These were great the first 2 months of LIGHT use, but they have no durability. I recently took a 3 week trip abroad and they could not stand up to the test. The side pocket zipper on one of the shoes broke, which looks odd and rendered it useless, the whole point of these shoes was to have a place to store money while I was traveling. And they are MOST DEFINITELY NOT water tight. You step into one puddle and your socks are soaked. The sole of the shoe right under the ball of my foot split open, so now ALL water gets into the sole. Do NOT buy these shoes, they are a waste of money. So after 4 months these are completely useless. See photos attached.

I like these boots I am a size 11 with a wide foot and they fit fine the pink is very pretty it look more like rose color boots and the side pocket is fine. I am plus size girl with big legs so they fit for me. So I went and order the blue one
reviews.review_header: I like these boots I am a size 11 with a ...

reviews.review_text: I'm sure no one needs another positive review of these boots, but as I'm about to buy my second pair, I had to share my feedback. These boots are just incredible. They fit comfortably from the get-go, but if you add some insoles, they become basically the best boots ever. The wee pockets are perfect for those days I don't want to carry a purse and just need a few small things. I've received so many compliments from much more fashionable friends over these boots, and they seem to go with just about everything. Attached picture pairs them with my Wild Bangarang ranger leggings, and the whole look was a perfect casual renn faire outfit. The only real negative I found was that the little buckle prong tips are a little sharp, and will snag on some leggings (and possibly make tiny holes if you aren't careful). I'm going to try filing them down a bit on my next pair to avoid this, but it's just something to watch out for! My first pair of these boots lasted about a year and a half with regular wear. I'm replacing them because one of them finally started to separate from the sole a bit. It's possible I could repair it, but the price is reasonable enough that I feel comfortable just buying a new pair outright. I'll likely be buying a few colors in the coming months, too!
reviews.review_header: Comfortable and cute - Totally a bargain!

reviews.review_text: These are some great quality boots for the price you pay. The color is as pictured. They're comfortable enough to start, and get better as you break them in. They were very squeaky at first, but I rubbed the backs and underneath the bucked with a tiny bit of coconut oil and now they're super quiet. I normally wear 8-9 size, bought 8.5 and they fit perfect. There's even room for thick socks. They end right below my calf and look just like the pictures show. They have a hard rubber sole with good tread. They're comfortable enough to wear, but I'm debating buying comfort in-soles just because I plan on hiking around New York for a week in them. The stitching appears to be stable, but I do wonder how long it will last. There's a couple threads sticking out, but they're barely a millimeter long. The laces aren't bad quality. The buckles in the back are just for show, they don't have any other holes for tightening or loosening; one could poke holes easy enough if they needed to. The pockets were a little hard to unzip at first and don't go all the way down (there's about an inch left at bottom) but after being used a couple times they work smoothly. They have plenty of room for a debit card and drivers license. The toes and heels are hard but do bend if stepped on with enough weight.

name: Forever Link Mango-21 Lady Boot

reviews.review_text: The boots are just like the picture which is a big relief when ordering online. The color of these boots are beautiful and look more than they are worth and the gold buckles and zipper is the cherry on top. These may not fit well for people with big calves, it was a close fit for me as I have semi big calves. Maybe without jeans they'd fit easier but they look so stylish with jeans. It has padding inside around the leg so it'll certainly keep you warm in the winter. At first they were tight like most shoes and can rub the pinky toe raw without socks but if you use a shoe stretcher or just wear them they will break in nicely. I recommend using thick socks until then. There is no padding for the feet and no arch support which is kinda bad but adding in your own arch support would make these the best boots. There is some wiggle room for toes but try ordering a size or half up if you have wide feet might be best. I would definitely recommend these to anyone who asked me. They are so nice and cheap so you don't have to waste 100$+ for nice Autumn boots.

ORIGINAL REVIEW: I just received these boots today and like any good amazon purchaser I ripped open the box and instantly put them all. Now I expected them to fit a little small (call me crazy but I'm little so I think things look better on me if they are a little smaller than bigger) so when I say they fit as expected, yes they are a little small. I normally wear a size 6 in all shoes and these kind of rub my big toe at the tip. If there are half sizes I would have bought that but I was scared a 7 would be to big. The struggle. But with that being said they are spacious on the sides width wise (again for my little feet) so no rubbing on the sides. Now onto the good stuff. These boots are awesome! I'm super impressive with the whole thing. The texture is great and they feel thick which is awesome because less flimsy parts up top. There is bend at the bottom but that's ok. My calves are the hardest things in most boots. Sense I'm small they are always SO BIG around the top half. Every boot usually looks like rain boots on me. These fit great! I can fit my figures in the top but not a huge gap. So if you have bigger calves it will probably be pretty snug. All in all I'll be ordering more. UPDATED: so sense I last reviewed these boots I bought 2 more. one Taupe and one black. I went ahead and ordered them in a 6 1/2 sense they had it in these colors. I have a little more room in the toes area than in the tan boots I ordered in the 6. The black boots seem to be slightly larger than the Taupe, but they are both size 6 1/2. Either way I still love them and wear all 3! It's like having a snug pair (tan size 6) a "perfect fit" (Taupe size 6 1/2) and a loose pair (black 6 1/2) but when looking at all of them you can't tell any size difference! All in all I still love these boots and still recommend them!

I purchased the Forever Link Women’s MANGO-21 boots in tan, and what I received in the mail was nothing short of a hilarious insult to Amazon customers. It’s hard to detail exactly what happened here, but I’ll try...upon opening the box, I was greeted with a musty foot funk that should’ve caused me to burn the package in my backyard. Instead of taping the box back up and calling the Department of Homeland Security to report a suspicious package, I further investigated and overflowed my nightmare fuel tank in the process. The shoes in the box were neither the model or color I ordered, but that was the least of my issues. This particular pair looks like they’ve been through a war. The heel sole is completely worn through the rubber, like it’s been gnawed off by thousands of hungry mountain leeches. The metallic buckles are rusted green as if they’ve been tied to a ocean buoy and battered by salty waves for decades. The leather has been distressed like the face of that lady who spent half of her yearly income to put a tanning bed in her kitchen. And the smell? Pickled eggs in the rotted pantry of a forgotten Cold War bunker. I can’t get that stink out of my front room. The vendor that I purchased these from, Fashion Unique, has some explaining to do. Specifically, why they sent me the well-loved boots of a veteran hobo. Please make this right!

Okay so I received these boots today & for those of you who are weird about packaging .. It was good I guess? I ordered them in a 6&1/2 color tan. For some reason when I first unboxed them I was kind of disappointed .. They looked a little too big & bulky. I decided to give them a try before I just abandoned them in my closet. I threw on some black leggings & tried them on & oh my gosh I just love them so much! They look beautiful . They don't look bulky at all ! They're true to size .. actually a little snug but I figure they'll be perfect for cold weather & big cozy socks. I've seen these go for 75-80$ in stores so for under 30$ they're definitely a great purchase. JUST BUY THEM .. you won't regret it !
I absolutely love these boots! Although, they are a little tight in the calves, which is expected with my large calves, I still wear them all the time!

I purchased these on October 24th and they've already fallen apart. The bottom of the show is completely coming off (see photo). The fit and softness inside the boot is great but I wish they had a longer life than 2 months!
reviews.review_header: Not for everyday wear. 2 months RIP.

reviews.review_text: Cute boots, and made well as far as I can tell. I just got them today so time will tell with how well they stand up to wear. I'm reviewing today on the super fast shipping and the fit. I wear an 8 in every single shoe that I own, so I can accurately say these run a tad small. I can wear them with a thin sock but they don't have much toe room. Go up a half size and they should fit fine.
reviews.review_header: Cute, but runs a little small

reviews.review_text: I want to give these boots a higher rating. I really do. But the toes got scuffed up on the very first time I wore them. I've put shoe polish on them and hopefully will be able to cover up the scuffs up easily. These boots are cheap, so you kinda get what you pay for. I like the fit and find them comfortable. Pretty true to size for size 11 shoe. If you don't wear boots often and are looking for a decent cheap pair, I would recommend these. If you will wear them all the time, it would be worth putting more money into a better quality pair.
reviews.review_header: I've put shoe polish on them and hopefully will be able to cover up the scuffs up easily. These boots are cheap

name: Brinley Co Women's Molly Knee High Boot

reviews.review_text: I purchased these in chestnut wide. I will be buying these again in the other two colors! They fit perfectly. There is plenty of room. Usually I struggle to fit into even wide calf boots, but these have plenty of extra room.
reviews.review_header: Lots of extra room - I usually struggle to wear wide calf!

reviews.review_text: I was so excited to get these, they were super cute but the foot is pretty narrow. I wear a size 8 and they were a tad snug, I could have been more comfortable in a wide foot otherwise I'd have to wear super thin sox. They are lined with a nice fuzzy fabric but there was at least and inch and a half gap between the zipper and there's no way I'd get it zipped. My calf is 18" so if you are 17" or over these definitely will not fit you.. Immediately packaged them up for return. I gave it 4 stars only because they are nice quality but definitely not what I'd consider a wide calf... hopefully I can get another pair that will fit... =( But I definitely recommend for those who don't have my problems, and maybe get a wide foot, otherwise my toes weren't smashed length wise...
reviews.review_header: they were super cute but the foot is pretty narrow

reviews.review_text: Only 4 stars because they sent me black when I ordered the dark brown ones. They fit great, comfy, and keep you warm. My calves are 17 inches and I have some wiggle room in them. The length stops right below my knee. Even though it's not the color I wanted still kept them because they look great on and you can't beat the price.

These boots are awesome, I would have kept them but I saw other reviews that stated they fit small. I ordered a size up and they came in too big, I should have ordered my size and I would have kept them. The return was quick and easy, I sent back my package and they refunded me promptly. Nice quality, high end looking boots.
reviews.review_header: These boots are awesome, I would have kept them but I saw ...

reviews.review_text: I'm usually a size 6.5 but got a 7 so that I would be able to wear socks with them. I'm glad I sized up bc the 6.5 would've been too small to wear with socks. I got the wide calf and have enough room for jeans or leggings without looking like they are glued to my legs.
reviews.review_header: I'm glad I sized up bc the 6

reviews.review_text: It is a nice looking boot, but my leg was swimming in it and it was the regular calf, not the wide calf. So if you have wide calves get them. They return was super easy. Got my money back within a week!

Overall these are good boots for the price. They have some fur type material inside which can make them a bit warm when you are indoors. They were true to size and seem to be made well. I am average size, my legs aren't super skinny, and I have some wiggle room in the calves, which is nice.
reviews.review_header: Overall these are good boots for the price

reviews.review_text: Bought these for my niece and she loves them. She said they are comfortable and cute. She's a teacher and wears all day.

name: CC Little Girls Knee High Flat Riding Boots Shoes

reviews.review_text: Completely fell apart after being lightly worn 4 or 5 times.
My five year old loves them!!!

My granddaughters favorite shoes so far! She wears them with everything! shorts, pants, skirts .... and they are surprisingly durable! My daughter has given them the "Surviving Cordi" stamp of approval even. So much so that I'm buying a 2nd pair now one size larger!

These boots are super cute. I actually got these to match a pair I had gotten. They are perfect. My daughter wears a 6 or 61/2 so I got a 7 so she can wear them in a few months for winter. Pictured are mine and hers. Mine are a size 8 1/2 and hers are a 7 toddler
reviews.review_header: These boots are super cute. I actually got these to match a ...

reviews.review_text: Amazing boots!! This is our third pair of this exact boot. My daughter wears them almost everyday. When she grows out of them they are still in amazing condition and I pass down to friends. I have never had any problems with these boots, even with repeated use. My only issue is that they are hard to find! First time buying them from Amazon, I usually buy from Zulily, but they raised the price by more than double. I was so happy to find them on Amazon and that they were cheaper! Will we still continue to buy this boot every time my daughter grows out of her old pair.

I ordered these in 2 different sizes and from the same place, one for my 7 yr old and these for my 4 yr old. I got the ones for my 4 yr old and they fit great and are super cute. But then then when I got the ones for my 7 yr old I got 2 different sizes which really bummed her out because they were part of her Halloween costume so in turn I was bummed that I had to send them back and the new ones wouldn't be here until after Halloween. So fingers crossed they send me the proper sizes this time around. So just make sure to check the sizes before you throw away the boxes they came in.

Love these boots for my granddaughter. I also bought them in brown. The boots are well made and don't wear out. I bought these before and when she out grew them there was plenty of wear left to pass down to her little sister.

My daughter needed/wanted a pair of high boots for a Halloween costume. She saw these and fell in love with them. She has worn them many times since Halloween and every time she wears them, people stop us and ask where we purchased them! They are adorable. Fit her perfectly

name: Sperry Women's Saltwater Rain Boot

reviews.review_text: These shoes are very comfortable and look great. Some of the qualities I'd like to make clear are: 1. These boots fit exactly to size. I'm a size 5 and reading some of the reviews, which mentioned that these run small, I got these shoes a size large and unfortunately found them to be a size bigger when worn. But because I did not want to go into the hassle of returning and waiting for the correct size (which would've taken a week or two and also because I needed warm boots due to the weather) I kept the Sperry's and ordered a pair of thick sheepskin insoles which thankfully did the trick. They wear perfectly now. 2. These are not meant to be winter boots! That is for deep winter climate like below 30 degrees Fahrenheit. They are insulated with a micro fleece, which makes them warm but your feet will not be complete warm if the weather is under 30 degrees. I live in NY where we're going through a cold spell these days, and without my cozy fleece foot liners my feet would've been cold. If you want real cold weather boots go with Sorel's winter boot line or something equivalent. 3. These boots are a little heavier than I'd thought they would be, not uncomfortably so, though. But definitely not light! 4. Yes, they're water proof and I assume snow proof but these do not have a firm grip on ice, as I have noticed they don't have traction on slippery surfaces (like ice or a shiny wet surface) even though they do have good traction on dry and uneven surfaces. 4. Very good quality shoe, well made and if you are like me, who keeps things well- then these will last an extremely long time which I'm looking forward to. 5. Overall very attractive, good quality, waterproof shoe for autumn, cold rain and mild winter but NOT for very cold weather and the sheepskin insert helps in making it a much warmer shoe. 6. I would've definitely preferred to buy it half a size or even a size smaller. FITS TRUE TO SIZE. I have slender, size 5 feet, but if I had flat or wide size 5 feet then the size 6 would've been perfect. I imagine this sizing will help those figuring out the right sizing for their feet in the future. Over all satisfied.
reviews.review_header: These shoes are very comfortable and look great

reviews.review_text: Bought these for my daughter for Christmas, not even a week later the seam has come apart.

I'm pretty sure these are knock offs or rejects from Sperry's china factory. The tongue tag is not what I would expect from Sperry, very basic and unprofessional looking. The inside of the boot has multiple unfinished seams. The tongue on the left shoe is sewn off center so it leans a little to the right. The left shoe is smaller than the right. My left foot is my smaller foot and I could barely get it in the boot. After wearing these around the house a few minutes, they're pretty comfortable and look cute. However, its extremely misleading, along with ILLEGAL, for Amazon to sell counterfeit boots. I saw another reviewer say that they weren't actually waterproof, but I'm too scared to try for fear I won't be able to return, since it was like pulling teeth to return the last pair I ordered in my normal size that were way too small.
reviews.review_header: Beware of knock offs and size and quality defects

reviews.review_text: It rains a lot where I'm from, because I live right next to the ocean. Let's get down to business! Pros:fits well for narrow or wide feet, light and comfortable feel, cozy and soft inside bc of material liner, feet stay warm and dry, awesome style for camping or just rainy days in the city. Cons: none so far So, if you wanna keep reading, I'm going to give you brief story. They came in just in time, it was a rainy day, like I said, it practically rains almost everyday where I'm from. And, it works and my feel stayed dry when it was pouring out side, I took a picture when it stop for a bit. Hope the picture can do enough justice as it really does.
reviews.review_header: IT CAME IN ON A RAINY DAY! YAS!

reviews.review_text: Love. Comfortable and cute. I wear an 8 or 8.5...ordered an 8 and they fit just right. With thick socks they might be a bit snug though. Go great with your rooster apron too.

These boots are amazing! That being said, it is important to note that they are intended for rain and not for extremely cold snowy conditions. Your feet will not be kept warm if you wear these in weather below freezing. In the Spring or Fall I can run through a puddle up to my ankle in these and not even know it. They are easy to style as well which makes them perfect for daily wear if you need it. I've had my pair for two years now and they are holding up great.
reviews.review_header: These boots are amazing! That being said

reviews.review_text: Best shoe purchase ive made in a long time! They're so comfortable and so cute! I think they're betting fitting than the L.L. Bean boots and definitely more support. I was worried the leather would be too dark but it actually lightens up a bit as you wear them. I get more compliments on these boots than ANYTHING else I own!

name: Rampage Women's Hansel Zipper and Buckle Knee-High Riding Boot

reviews.review_text: Loooove these boots. I got a half size up (7), I usually wear a 6 1/2) because I wanted to be able to wear thick socks or leg warmers with them. I also have pretty muscular legs and was worried about my calf not being able to fit but there is the perfect amount of room. The greyish brown color goes with so much so I can wear it with pretty much everything. I have a high arch in my foot and these boots do well with my feet. Worth every penny!

I was looking for a pair of black boots and spent entirely too much time looking at different pairs... I finally settled on these, even though there were zero reviews at the time. I am totally happy with my purchase! I was worried about the calf area being too tight, but they fit perfectly, even with pants & socks underneath. They also have an elastic cutout on the inside, so that helps with the tightness. They are super comfortable too! Highly recommended!

I've had these boots for almost a year, I wore them all winter, a minimum of 4x a week. They are still in great shape. The bottom heels are starting to wear, but I never had a broken zipper or buckle. I normally wear a 7 or 8, I ordered an 8 and they fit perfect. I also must mention they keep your feet at the perfect temperature. During the winter they kept my feet toasty warm (but never sweaty). I was always cold when I would take them off. Lots of compliments. Great price, great quality! Fantastic buy!

I am pretty disappointed about these boots. The picture looks just like what I want and the description does not say anything about being a wide calf. Well sure enough they arrived and they are super wide calf. They are going to look so sloppy with leggings that I'm not sure if I want to keep them. I wish it would have said some were clearly in the description that these are wide calf.
reviews.review_header: Not a clear description. These are wide calf boots.

reviews.review_text: As far as aesthetics go, this boot looks pretty nice. It's faux leather, but doesn't look cheap. The shaft is pretty soft, but the foot of the boot is hard - I think it would have taken some breaking in. However, I didn't get a chance to wear them out because this "wide-calf" boot is not particularly wide calf. I have about a 16" calf and the description reads that the calf of the boot is 15.5". If it were a zip-up boot, I think I would have been fine, but because it was pull-on it's too tight. That was my other gripe, I didn't realize it was a pull-on boot. There is a small zipper on the inside of the ankle that's maybe 6", but the long zipper that you see in the photos is not a working zipper, so you have to pull on the boot. I'm not sure what compels people to make boots with small zippers at the ankles that go halfway up... just make it a full pull on boot, that zipper isn't doing anyone any favors!
reviews.review_header: Not very wide calf and it's a pull-on boot!

reviews.review_text: I'm always a size 9 and these fit perfectly in size 9. They held up really well for a synthetic fashion boot. I clean them regularly, so that helps. Keep in mind that they are fashion boots so they don't have much built-in support. I tend to pull them on without unzipping, but the lack of a strong heel cup means that you're better off unzipping them to put them on so you don't squish the back of the boot. In all, they're a great pair of boots for this price range and they work with many different outfits!

The sole has little tread, but good for wearing out to dinner, church, etc. These are not snow boots - no insulation. very nice for fashion and wearing with hose or tights. there's enough room to tuck in slacks also. The long side zipper is not functional - there is another zipper on the inside calf ankle area which makes the boots easy on and off. Very pleased with quality for the price. Not sure how they will hold up if worn regularly out in bad weather - but these are just what I wanted for wearing as indoor boots.
reviews.review_header: but good for wearing out to dinner

reviews.review_text: The fit of the boot was prefect. The quality of materials was not good. The boots pleather look very cheap. I actually had a piece of the pleather come off. If I could return them I would.
reviews.review_header: The quality of materials was not good. The boots pleather look very cheap

name: Fergalicious Women's Lexy Western Boot

reviews.review_text: Absolutely love them!! Looks and feels sexy and comfortable! My friend who buys expensive boots thought they were expensive and she loved them. She's going to order these too!!! Foolproof! I have super skinny calves. I gave chicken legs so they felt just right. I don't know if wide calves will fit in these bc my another friend tried mine on she could not zip it close. She has wide bulky calves. I feel bad for her. She gets frustrated like OMING for beautiful and sexy looking boots to fit her. I have to say it again I love them sooooo much. They are so comfortable. I had 2 surgeries on my feet. I'm able to walk in these without wincing. Both thumbs up!!! I in fact bought 3 pairs!!!! 3 same brand but different model boots. They feel all the same. So sexy!! Saves $$$$$ big time! Pictures show 2 different model boots but same brand. Sporting grey and taupe. The black boot with zipper will arrive tomorrow!!!!!
reviews.review_header: Awesome fit awesome looking boots. SEXY AND COMFORTABLE

reviews.review_text: OMG! 1st I'd like to say thank you, thank you, thank you to all the reviewers who suggested to order a 1/2 size bigger. I'm a strong size 7 and have 16.50 circumference calves. Wide calves but not wide feet, nor are they narrow; I have average feet and ordered the 7.5 WC (wide calf) in Taupe. This photo does this boot NO JUSTICE!! It looks and feels a lot more expensive than it is. I was pleasantly surprised & the exterior texture is not the faux leather look it appears to be. It's actually soft to the touch almost velvety but it's not and hard to explain. My first reaction was, "woah," followed by me feeling up the boot ever so gently as if it was fragile lol. Now for the fit...I always have a hard time finding boots and was prepared to squeeze my calves in as soon as the zipper was approaching the top. To my surprise, I had no issues whatsoever and they went right up with NO struggle. Whoever thought to design a v-shape opening in the back of the boot is a pure genius! I believe this is why the boots fit without a problem. Oh, almost forgot!!! In the pic, the bottoms appear to be the slippery wood finish but NOOOO it's not!!! It's a rubber material ladies so no slipping!!!! The heel is like any other but the rest is rubber so yaaay!!! Don't be hesitant! Order these a 1/2 size larger and you'll be pleased!
reviews.review_header: I'm a 7 with 16.5 calves-ordered 7.5 WC Taupe

reviews.review_text: When I purchased these boots, there was not much of a description or pictures, as there is now. But I took a chance and ended up ordering the (wc) not knowing it was wide calf, again, there was not much info up like there is now. It turned out great, have plenty of room to tuck pants in and even wear thick socks when it is colder out. They are nicely made, very comfortable. I usually have problems with the part on the instep, most times too tight and have to stretch them out, but not this pair. Just luv the style. In fact the day I got them went back to order another pair in a different color. Wish I would had waited just a few days to order because the price dropped and could had saved some money, but hey, I did on the second pair.

These boots are EXACTLY what I have been searching for. The last five years, since this style boot became popular I have not been able to fit boots that fit over my calves. I am petite, athletic, and have muscular calves. These fit so perfectly I can fit my skinny jeans, with socks on in them and there is still room to breathe. They are perfect for wearing with tights and a skirt, for extra freedom. I loved them so much, two days later I bought the same pair in brown! I am wearing them now!! For reference, the circumference of my calves at 14" around, and these are perfect. The shoe size itself is also as expected, am a perfect 6.5. Purchase these boots now and thank me later!!
reviews.review_header: Have wide calves? These boots will fit. Promise.

reviews.review_text: Still love them! Just because you get the wide calf, don't expect wide foot! I normally wear a 9.5 to 10, I ordered 10WC and they were a little snug across my foot...I never have this with a 10, but I still love them.

Love! These are the cutest most comfortable boots! I ordered these in the wide calf because of the other reviews, however I think I could have got away with the regular. The only thing is with the extended calf I do have extra room for thick boots socks and jeans. I also ordered a half size up and glad I did. Due to the shape of the footbed and toe I recommend going up a half size. These boots are so stylish and sexy. They look great with jeans or dresses. Very versatile to dress up or down. I now want to order the other two colors. Just waiting for my size to be back in stock. The height of the heel is perfect. Not too tall or short. Comfortable to wear all day. I ordered the taupe and feel it is a versatile color. I can bring out more brown, tan or grey in them depending on the colors I wear with them.
Bought these as a dressy alternative for fall and I love them! Comfortable with the low heel they are perfect with a dress or jeans.

name: Twisted Women's Noah Knee High Faux Leather Boots with Buckle Straps

reviews.review_text: I am returning these boots for a few reasons: 1. Once I opened the box, the boots had a few white marks on them (see pic) 2. The bottom of the boots have NO traction, which can be very dangerous to walk. When I tried them off, I almost slipped on carpet. Ridiculous!

I probably should do this in a few days because I can't speak on the comfort but they are super cute, good quality, great color and so far they are comfy, just haven't done much walking in them. They fit my calves great but would say if you have larger calves these boots are not for you.

These boots looked cute, which is why I bought them. The box was cute too, which is why I'm keeping the box. Now to the negative, the boots have no tread at all. I wore them maybe twice and the soles already have separated from the shoe. And they are not very comfortable.

Giving three stars because they were super cute! However, they were too snug and the calves were not big enough either. I don't have "big" calves per say, however my legs are muscular and they were too tight. Also, if you have wide feet these shoes are not for you! I am a size 8 with everything and these were too small for me. Oh and when you take them off you have to sit down. lol. That's how snug they are. I also didn't like that there was literally NO traction on the bottom except for on the heel. Needless to say, I returned them and I will not purchase another because of these. :( I know a size 9 would be way too big and at the time I ordered they did not or do not have half sizes! Hope this helps!

I bought these for my daughter (16) because of the cheap price and I was unsure how much she would actually wear them. I also read all the reviews and a major complaint seemed to be that the width was somewhat narrow, and my daughter has skinny legs and she tends to look like she is swimming in boots, so these were perfect because of the narrow calves. She is also over 6ft and the height was perfect mid calf, so if you are shorter they may come up higher than you wanted. Overall, we are very happy with the purchase and she will get a year's worth of wear out of them at least, and for the price that is well worth it.

Perfect! I love these boots. Some complain they are slippery on the bottom, but mine have plenty of traction. They are the perfect color and go with any thing ... and with any color outfit. I'm 5'10" and these hit just a few inches under my knee. I have fairly muscular calves and these fit fine. Not to big around the calf and not too small.

I only have these boots for a couple of weeks and they are falling apart. The left boot heal is falling off and the side of the boot is separating. Please advise me how to return these boots and to get another pair. Thank you Jeanette Caron
reviews.review_header: I only have these boots for a couple of weeks ...

reviews.review_text: I wanted to love these boots but they were too small. I even bought a half a size up. They are super cute and came nicely packaged but I expected them to go up to the bottom of my knee but they were about 5 inches below. To buyers I would recommend getting at least one full size bigger and don't expect these boots to be tall. Very cute, just not what I was looking for...
reviews.review_header: I wanted to love these boots but they were too small

name: Femizee Girls Boys Warm Winter Flat Shoes Bailey Button Snow Boots(Toddler/Little Kid)

reviews.review_text: Lets be fair, these are $16. You can not expect Ugg quality for that price. Are they great quality? No. Will they fit my daughter for the season before she outgrows them quickly like everything else? Yes!! So for $16 I am happy enough. They came smooshed in a bag which took a few days for them to look normal again. But they ars still cute. They will not keep your feet dry and I wouldn't recommend for rain or snow. Use for chilly days in dry weather. I live in Southern California, so they will work for our winter. I feel they run a bit small. My daughter wears a 9 to 9.5 right now, so I bought a 10. The 10 seems to fit right on. So buy at least a half size up.
reviews.review_header: Cute and exactly what I expected for the price.

reviews.review_text: These boots are super comfortable and really easy to get on and they don’t slip off - they’re really cute definitely worth the price highly recommend
reviews.review_header: These boots are super comfortable and really easy to get on and they ...

reviews.review_text: I bought these shoes for my 5 year old girl and 3 year old boy to wear as part of matching outfits for our trip to Arizona in the winter when it averaged about 40 degrees Fahrenheit. The shoes were absolutely adorable from the moment i opened my package in the mail, and worked out even better after the kids tested them out. The shoes fit true to their regular shoe size, they slip right on their feet, and as my 5 year old said - "They're as warm as the desert." HAHA! They both wore them with no socks in very cold weather and the shoes kept their feet nice and toasty. I was afraid the shoes wouldn't survive one wear by toddlers who aren't the gentlest creatures, but they held up great and I trust them to survive many more wears even though they were so affordably priced! I would absolutely recommend these shoes and this seller, and Yes, boys can wear these too!!
reviews.review_header: Absolutely adorable and YES, boys can wear them too!

reviews.review_text: The product arrived on time and the product looked like the pictures. However, for some reason the boots were completely soaked through with some kind of liquid. They took 2 days to dry out, and once they were dry, the smell was musty and gross. As a side note, the soles of the shoes are not rubber, but a thick foam- they seem as though they would wear out very quickly.

These are the cutest boots ever, my daughter gets compliments anywhere we go. They look like real uggs! My daughter seems to love them too, they look comfortable and fashionable. They do tend to fit a little loose if you don't put them on with thick socks but it's warmer that way anyway. Love them!
its so cute... perfect for cold weather...

This is the second pair I have purchased of these boots the first being size 7 for when mu daugjter was 2 and nownsize 8 that she is 3. The boots fit very well. They are very warm and waterproof. She likes to wear them for snow play or just going out in cold weather. She also likes them in the summer evenings after the beach. She likes that she can put them on and off herself. They have a very cute look and high quality material. I plan to purchase them again for next year when she is gets bigger.

These boots were amazing we live in the north and it snows a lot obviously these boots lasted us through this harsh winter so far the button has not ripped the Fur is amazing I have put it through the wash a few times and nothing has happened to the boots the sold on the boots are quite thick so they still have support which is something that I don't like about a lot of children's boots they lose the foot support on the bottom these are great price for the type of boot that you're getting. They look exactly like UGGs and they actually have the print on the bottom but they don't say UGGs they go with a lot of her outfita so I'm really satisfied with this purchase

name: FAYBOX Short Women Crochet Boot Cuffs Winter Cable Knit Leg Warmers

reviews.review_text: I ordered the gray cuffs and absolutely love them! They're especially handy for the boots I own that can't accommodate thicker socks. I have very skinny calves so they also help to fill out the top of my boots that sometimes don't hug my legs like I want them to. I was worried that these cuffs might not stay in place but they were rock solid through a long day at work. I had some strings here in there but that's common with any crocheted item. I can wear these several times without washing which makes them pretty hard to beat. I plan on ordering more colors now!
reviews.review_header: The perfect solution for style and comfort

reviews.review_text: Great quality and super cute! I got the black and ivory, they are cozy and warm. Love these socks.

I actually really like them, but they are tight since I am only wearing them at the top under tall boots. I have 14 inch calves. I am right in between regular size boots and wide calf boots, so I read the description on this and saw that they were stretchy and fit mostly all (This really isn't true). The material is not very stretchy. The reviews are great and the rating is high so I figured I would give them a try. I will still keep them. Love the Crochet work, and the color though!
reviews.review_header: They are cute, but if you have 14 inch calves or larger, do not get these! They are tight!

reviews.review_text: Great find.

These leg warmers are definitely cute for Seattle in the middle of winter under cute boots. I just removed one star because the fit was a little weird. The material used to put these babies together is not very stretchy. If your calf is more than 15in. wide, these probably won't fit you too comfortably.

These boot toppers are just the thing if you are tall with legs on the thin side. Boots in larger sizes for tall women so often have wider shafts that gap around your jeans if you are slim. I bought these and they totally change the look. I put my warm socks on and then my jeans, and then pulled these on over my jeans to my knees. Next, your boots. Tuck the bottom edge into your boot top, and kind of "slouch" the rest. Fills in the gap perfectly for a more finished look, plus keeps rain and snow out of your boots. I now have several pair - including the ones that are half and half and reverse to two different colors. Just love them!

I have never bought a pair of these before, but thought they were cute and would give it a try. I love the material and the fit. They are a nice feel and look just as the picture shows. I had no trouble putting them on and they fit my calves and in my boots perfectly. I would buy these again and actually did buy them in a different color. Just a fun accent!
Khaki color is completely wrong. Doesn't match the other khaki I have. The picture is me comparing the real khaki to what they sent me.

name: SJP by Sarah Jessica Parker Women's Minnie Ankle Bootie

reviews.review_text: Gorgeous and fit my 8.5 foot nicely.
The most beautiful boots I own. Cannot recommend them enough.
I'm 5'3", and this boogie is a perfect fit. You can still tuck in jeans/leggings, yet it doesn't cut off your leg at mid calf so you look short.
reviews.review_header: and this boogie is a perfect fit. You can still tuck in jeans/leggings

reviews.review_text: My daughter loved the shoes. They fit perfect
I really love them!!
These boots are simply perfect: size, color, comfort, fit, etc.
Super cute ~ well made

I purchased a size too large because my size was not available. FYI: Scintillate is a crazy glittery color - it's WILD! I'm all about magenta as a neutral or neon pink or electric blue, etc. I keep the kicks colorful. The only justification for wearing a solid/plain/black dress is so I don't distract from the pow pow going on at my feet. And frankly, I don't mind mixing pow-pow from top to bottom so I'm pretty sure ppl get dizzy when they see me. But, I've never had trouble getting found in a crowd. :) That said, Scintillate may be too much even for me. If you're bold enough to go for it, just know this, the background/tone is cool gray. Some skin tones will look washed out - particularly those of us with pinkish skin tones. Kinda yuck. They haven't gone back yet, but they probably will. sigh.
reviews.review_header: Scintillate is OVER-THE-TOP glittertastic (not actual glitter, better fabric)

name: DREAM PAIRS Women's Flat Knee High Boots

reviews.review_text: I spend a lot of time reading reviews before purchasing anything online, and it usually pays off. This time I overlooked a few of the things that previous reviewers mentioned, so I just wanted to highlight those for everyone else looking. The first is that these boots definitely run narrow at the toe. I ordered a half size up (like others suggested) and they fit... but a full size up might have made them more comfortable. The fact that the toe is slightly pointed might cause this (which is not very visible in the pictures). If you have even slightly wide feet I wouldn't recommend these. The second is that the calf runs small compared to other similar boots (14.5 inches here vs. 15 inches on others). This is clearly stated in the description, but it's worth a mention. If the wide calf option (16.5 inches in the description) was available I would have definitely ordered those. Overall, however, these look like very well made and stylish boots. If you have narrow feet and slender calves, and like a pointed toe, these might be perfect for you! [Details for photos: I'm 6' tall, so these fall about 4" below my knee. Also, my calves measure 15" (and a bit bigger in jeans), but these boots stretch slightly for a snug fit. Additional photo to show the pointed toe.]
reviews.review_header: Narrow toe and slim calf, but great quality!

reviews.review_text: LOVE THEM!!! Perfect fit & super cute!!!
I absolutely love these boots. They look nice and fit around my calves perfectly. The only negative is that there is very little tread so I slip around on wood or tile.

I love the way these boots look. I haven't had them that long, but I'm hoping they stretch out a little in the top of the foot. The width and length are great, but the top of my foot rubs occasionally. The material is soft and looks more expensive than these really are. No arch support. A little heel about 1/2 inch. A little loud on hard floors, but not as bad as many I've owned before. Calves are a little bigger than I need, but it makes it easy to fit skinny jeans into them. Or just leggings. I have skinny calves and big thighs, which is why I buy boots that are almost knee high though.

Wow, I’m very impressed by these boots. They are extremely comfortable, surprisingly light-weight and have a cozy-warm lining that makes them perfect for fall. At this price, they are an excellent deal. I’ve been wearing them regularly since I purchased them and I’m glad to report that they have kept up well.

These boots are comfortable, but unfortunately not good quality. I have only had them for 10 days and have worn them 4 times. They are already scuffed up so badly on the toe area that I can’t wear them anymore.

My boots were delivered while I was at work. I got home and opened the shoebox....and found my boots had been used. This is completely unacceptable and incredibly infuriating, not to mention gross. Were they hoping I'd e-mail them and keep them for a discount? No. I ordered new boots. They should have sent me new boots. Returning and reordering in hopes of getting new boots this time. Hopefully it was just a fluke. Since I had them here, I tried them on. A few reviewers suggested going up a half size, so I got a 7 and it fit perfectly (I normally wear a 6 1/2, sometimes wide). I have thicker calves, so the boot was a little snug, but it wasn't uncomfortable at all. They're actually pretty nice boots for the price. Had I recieved new boots I would have been really happy with them and gladly given 5 stars. These boots are an amazing deal. Unfortunately, their quality control needs some work, and it really pisses me off how often I've been receiving used merchandise when ordering on Amazon lately.
These boots are great! I ordered a 7.5 in the brown pu and they fit and look awesome. They fit true to size and are very comfortable.
reviews.review_header: These boots are great! I ordered a 7

name: Global Win Women's KadiMaya16YY21 Boots

reviews.review_text: I really like these boots. They fit nice and feel well made. I can go my entire word day with plenty of walking and my feet don't hurt.
