reviews.review_text: I followed what the reviews said and ordered my daughter a size up and it was a perfect fit.... shes normally a size 8 and we ordered a 9 and they were perfect. Not too bulky of heavy and the material is nice on the outside and inside.
reviews.review_header: ... my daughter a size up and it was a perfect fit.

name: DREAM PAIRS Women's Suede Leather Sheepskin Fur Lining Winter Boots

reviews.review_text: I am a size 6 in uggs and so I bought these in a size 6 as well. I prefer my Ugg’s snug. I didn’t want to fork up over a $100 on a new pair of uggs so I took a chance on these and I am so glad I did! These are exactly what I was looking for a fraction of the price. These seem very well made and the bottom is made of good quality rubber, not this cheap cork a lot of knock offs are made of these days. You can definitely where these outside or inside. I will probably be ordering more pairs as Christmas gifts. 🎁

Omg these are so cozy!! I think I will use them as my slippers around the house as well as out and about because they are so darn warm and comfy. So glad I read other reviews to order 1 size up. I wear a size 10 so I ordered 11 and they are a perfect fit! I got the gray and brown to see which color I liked better and I am keeping both!!! LOVE!!! GET THEM!!
reviews.review_header: Yes you need them! Order 1 size up

reviews.review_text: i was a bit skeptical about buying these because of how inexpensive they were but they just came in today and let me say WHAT A DEAL. i have owned uggs before and they are so unbelievably similar it's great. i am definitely will be repurchasing this item. i am so satisfied with this order. highly recommend

Order Your true size, they will form to your feet a little cause they're lined. The traction on these are great and they are comfortable, kept my feet warm in 8° weather with NO socks & in snow & no slipping. So much better than paying hundreds for Uggz or bearpaws. Now typically I don't like this kind of shoe because I was never interested in anything that looks like Uggz lol (they're Uggly...in my opinion) . I just wanted something warm and comfotable for my wide feet & these are awesome.

I spent quite a bit of time looking for a real leather boot with real sheepskin that was less then $100. I read so many reviews and finally came across these. They seemed like just what I was looking for. I have them on my feet right now and I have to admit that they are just what I expected they would be. I knew they would be nicer than the cheapest boot out there but also not superb. I think that these are better investment than bearpaws because they seem to be made just as well and will probably last just as long. Only complaint I have about these and reason for not giving five stars is that the left is slightly shorter on the inside of the boot. It's hardly noticeable though so I'm perfectly happy with them. The souls are durable enough for outside use. Cute enough to wear out with the right clothes and also could be used for inside lounging. Either way nice Boot and I'm very happy.
reviews.review_header: Better then what u pay for.

reviews.review_text: Omg I love these!!! Great quality and great price! I’m a true size 8, I ordered size 8 and it fits great (I wear Costco Kirkland brand socks) I bought 3 pairs. Originally I bought the “kookaburra by uggs” and I returned them because the quality of these boots surpasses those and the price is great! I bought black, side comparison to uggs in sand color.

I don't like to buy uggs because 1) I only wear these type of boots when im doing errands and I'm not trying to worry about ruining them. 2) I don't like when they look worn so id rather just get a new pair every year and this price point is amazing 3) uggs are freaking expensive and not even that cute but they are purposeful so that's why i always buy fuggs...lol Anyways these boots are freaking amazing for this price point. They are high quality and the fit is perfect... they don't feel bulky or heavy and I can wear them without socks or with heavy socks. I'm very happy with these boots and the reason I bought from this company was after I bought my husband slippers and they were also made well. I'm a true size 9 and these fit my foot perfect. I would buy them again.
reviews.review_header: These are a nice comfortable fit and not bulky or heavy

reviews.review_text: These boots are really inexpensive, which makes their downsides a little easier to take. The soles are fairly heavy, which can help for walking in slippery conditions. However, the heavy, solid soles are really uncomfortable for walking anything over semi-short distances. As other reviews have stated, the outside material is very hard and scratchy, making these boots difficult to roll up or down. I just leave them down because if I roll them up to make taller boots, you can tell they are cheap because the fabric looks wrinkled and crispy. Cute enough to wear to/from public transport in winter, however!
reviews.review_header: Inexpensive, can't walk far in them, a little hard

name: Globalwin Women's 18YY06 Fashion Boots

reviews.review_text: These were really comfortable, but they fell apart after only a couple months

I don't write alot of reviews but wanted to for these boots. They fit good and look really nice. About the fit, roomy in the foot, I could wear cozy socks if I wanted too. I have healthy 15 1/2 inch calves, some boots fit some don't. These are snug on my calves, not tight but no extra space. Hope this helps someone, measure those calves lol. Hope they last a couple winters, I really like these!

I'm usually a size 9 and had to get these in a 8.5. The black boots are still a little bit loose but size 8 may have been too small while the brown boots size 8.5 fit perfectly. I don't have skinny legs but no issues there. Great boots for the price and wore them for a whole day right away with no problems.

Ive only been wearing these for 2 weeks and the zipper completely crapped out. Also the strap that holds the buckle after a week came off and I had to resew. Will not purchase from this seller again and would not recommend these boots. Wish I could still get a refund but I purchased these 32 days ago now.
reviews.review_header: DO NOT BUY- cheaply made and zipper broke within 2 weeks

reviews.review_text: Cute boots! They are as pictured. Fit large. They are big in the calves I had to cut extra holes in the buckles to tighten them more. You definitely need insoles with these. But definitely worth a buy. They are cute and look great with my leggings.

Received my product on time. Love the boots they are exactly as advertised and the inside is extremely comfortable. I have worn them in the rain, and a little snow and my feet have remained warm (did not need to double up on socks). Which is a HUGE plus for me. I did however notice when I first pulled them from the box one of the boots near the inside zipper has a snag so the fabric is pulled a little. You can’t reqdily tell but I know it’s there and you know it only gets worse if that snag gets caught on something. Overall though love them and would buy again.

I purchased two pairs of these boots and they are great! They are very roomy, they are wide from the front and warm inside. I'm a size 8.5 and purchased a size 9. I wish I would have ordered an 8.5 since they do come wide and feel a tiny bit big. I recommend these boots I will definitely purchase again!

The overall quality doesn’t seem too bad for the price. They have kind of a spongey feel to them and a lot of rustling noise come from them when you walk. They are very loose around the ankles and possibly a half size bigger with a little room up the calves but are not necessarily wide calf boots. I think they are comfy for a throw on to run some errands cold day, not too bad but you are definitely getting the price worth.
reviews.review_header: You get what you pay for

name: 206 Collective Women's Balcom Short Back-Zip Shearling Ankle Boot

reviews.review_text: After getting frustrated with the expensiveness and poor fit of UGGS, I decided to try these boots. I'm glad I did because I like them much better than UGGS...the quality of the sheepskin is just as good (and even though the description says that these are suede lined with sheepskin, they are sheepskin, with a little patch of suede on the heel) and the styling and fit is better. It is great to have a zipper in the back for people like me with a high instep/ high arches, and the shaft of the boot and the area around the ankle and top of the foot is narrow enough so that the boots don't move around too much when you walk. The footpad is a nice thick sheepskin, providing comfort and cushioning. Regarding sizing: I am almost always a size 9, but since some reviews said that these run a little large and since I just had to return a pair of UGGS in a size 9 because they were too loose, I decided to try an 8. Although they fit snugly and my toe goes to the end of the boot, they are comfortably snug and I can walk in them without them flopping around. Because of my high instep and the fact that the zipper does not go down to the bottom of the boot, they do not slip on easily, but rather I have to work them on carefully so as not to break the zipper (which is sturdy, fortunately), but I imagine that they will stretch out a bit over time. Even though my toe is at the end of the boot, because the sheepskin is so soft, they are not uncomfortable...I have used orthotic footpad inserts in similar boots in the past, but so far I don't need them in these due to the nice cushioning of the sheepskin footpad. So, I'm not sure if these really run big (I notice that the European sizing is 38 for a size 8, rather than the usual 39--but they are the same length as my Haflinger clogs in a size 39), but I would say that if you are a half size regularly, you should probably size down. If you are a full size, you could size down a full size (as I did), but only if you want them to fit snugly. If you have high arches (like me), know that you may find it a little hard to get them on, even with the zipper, especially if you size down. All in all, I love the boots--they are comfortable, well made, and half the price of the UGGS.
reviews.review_header: Comfortable, high quality materials, well made

reviews.review_text: So beautiful in person. The color, the feel, the fit! And to boot (yes, dry pun intended), the unbelievable sale price of $12.08. This was my 2nd pair, but I won't stop buying this collection, even if i have to pay the occasional full price. I'm on SSI and simply cannot afford the other brand of boots that I've needed to wear due to numerous foot surgeries. I find these to be a slight bit larger in length in the foot bed, but due to the zipper, it can fit better and more suited to your foot so its not clopping around loosly. Customer for life!
reviews.review_header: If you don't need "label"and would like a more tailored boot, this is it.

reviews.review_text: These are BEAUTIFULLY made. Very nice lining that covers the entire interior. The zipper allows it to be a snugger, less 'floppy' fit than other brands. Star reduction is for the sizing - I am a narrow 7.5 and while I think it's safe to assume the 7s would stretch comfortably over time, the issue was that my big toe would ostensibly start to shove off the edge of the sole. As such, the 8s are too big given the stretch over time. Oh well. Give them a try if you're a whole size!
reviews.review_header: Made very well, but lack of half sizes a No for me

reviews.review_text: I have a few pairs of UGGS and love them. Was thinking of buying a pair in grey, then found these on Amazon. They just arrived and when I put my feet into them, they felt as heavenly as UGGS. They have a lower profile, which make my feet look smaller than UGGS do. The quality is excellent and the shearling lining feels every bit as comfortable as UGGS for half the price. They run true to size for me, which is a size 8. Try them out, you won't be disappointed!
reviews.review_header: Amazing and feel just like UGGS

reviews.review_text: I was looking for a cheap Ugg alternative and these are amazing! They are super soft and warm, and feel similar to uggs. They are actually more flattering because the leg opening is narrower (hence the need for a zipper). I bought these for walking the dog on cold New England fall/winter nights. Now I look forward to chilly walks so I can wear these cozy boots!

Oh man, I am obsessed with these! I had bear paws that lasted me about 10 years (of light wear - I dont really wear them out of the house too often). I finally tossed those and purchased these and I actually wear these out of the house because they are so nice. The quality is AMAZING. I feel like I have Uggs on at a fraction of the cost. I'm usually a 6.5-7 and I ordered a 7. They fit perfectly. Slight heel slip without socks on, but I don't mind at all. LOVE LOVE LOVE
reviews.review_header: I finally tossed those and purchased these and I actually wear these out of the house because they are so nice. The quality is AMAZING

reviews.review_text: These boots are nice. Warm inside and I think will be great for anyone needing warm boots for winter. I returned them for the next size up. I wear a 7 and based on reviews that’s what I ordered. My toe was at the end. The next size up fits great. After they stretch a little bit and with warm socks they should be just right.
The 7 bit me in at the ankle. The 8 was too big. Quality shoe. I wish it would have fit me.

name: 206 Collective Women's Bellevue Shearling Ankle Boot

reviews.review_text: the opening at the top of the boot is so tight, so small I can't get my foot into the boot! If I could get my foot down into the boot it might fit just fine, but since that's not happening without serious boot surgery this was money wasted
reviews.review_header: boot opening too high, tight. Foot won't go into it

reviews.review_text: Found these on some kind of ridiculous bargain pricing day and I am really pleased with my purchase.These are a solid, well made pair of boots that are incredibly warm and cozy. My only piece of advice would be to size up if you're a half size. I'm a 10.5 but bought an 11 and they fit perfectly.
reviews.review_header: cozy, warm, and cute but round up if you're a half size

reviews.review_text: I love my soft pink suede/shearling boots. I plan to wear it around the house in the winter. It’s every bit as nice as my Uggs without the price tag. I purchased the size 5 and it’s snug at first, but the fit will relax and be perfect for me. The shearling is very soft and warm.

These replaced an old pair of similar Uggs. Much better price & they look are less clunky than my old ones. I gave it a 4 only because they are a little hard to pull on, as I have high arches, but I've once on they fit fine (size 8). I solve the pulling-on problem with a shoe horn.

Love them. No complaints. Normally wear wide 6.5 or regular 7. Ordered a seven but they will stretch out so I also order a 6 in the brown. So 7 are great when wearing socks, 6 will be good in bare feet. I wear these as often as my uggs.
Nice boots! They run small (I bought an 8, my toe almost hits the front) and they are a bit tight, so if you have a wide foot, you should size up. Good craftsmanship, well made boot.
Great off-brand alternative to the more-expensive Uggs. Fit fabulous, great colours, and very comfortable!
reviews.review_header: Just like Uggs only cuter, more available, and in better colors!

reviews.review_text: So comfortable! And amazing price! No need to spend over $100 on Uggs. These are great!

name: Forever Link Womens Mango-31 Round Toe Military Lace Up Knit Ankle Cuff Low Heel Combat Boots

reviews.review_text: I get lots of compliments on these. I usually wear either a 7 or 7.5 and after reading reviews decided to go with the 7.5 to leave room for socks, and I'm glad I did because they fit great! They also have nice grippy soles and I really like the faux-sock look, it softens the combat boot look a bit. My only complaint, which I was aware of from reading the reviews but bought them anyway, is that I WISH the side zipper was how you take them on and off... BUT IT ISN'T! I hate having to lace them up. I always choose my zip-up boots instead of these when I'm in a hurry. I'd probably buy them again in another color if it weren't for that... If you aren't lazy like me then go for it!
reviews.review_header: Cute, But I Hate Lacing Them Up

reviews.review_text: The one star reflects the fact that this boot fell apart on March 3, 2017, after being ordered barely three months earlier (Dec. 30, 2016). If they had held together, I'd be giving them five stars, since the quality seemed good and my granddaughter loved them and wore them often. But there's no justification for a boot to lose its entire sole and heel after 3 months - or even 3 years. I've contacted Cambridge Select to ask for a replacement pair, but since the return period is past, I'll have to hope Amazon lets the message go through and Cambridge Select decides to make it right.
reviews.review_header: Five Stars Until They Fell Apart After 3 Months of Wear

reviews.review_text: Absolutely love these! Everybody says to order up half a size, but you need to wear REALLY thick socks, if you order half a size up. I live in San Francisco, so I won’t wear these in super cold weather ever. I ended up putting memory gel insoles in them to make them A) fit better (remember I ordered half a size up, they’d be perfect in my normal size) and B) more comfortable for long trips. I bought them for my Yosemite trip and after being on my feet for about 14 hours, they were still quite comfortable! The only annoying thing is having to lace them up everytime. Other than that, they are awesome!

I'm already loving the fact that these look just like the stock photo. I ordered the premium tan pu boots and I really like them. My only complaint is that they're a bit smaller than I thought. I normally wear a size 9.5 US woman's and ordered the biggest size available at the time of purchase, which was the 10. My toe is very close to toe of the boot and the shoes do feel a little tight in the front area. Everywhere else (the heel, calf, etc.) feels just fine. Luckily, I'm not planning on wearing them for a long period of time anyway, I'm using them for a cosplay, so they won't be on my feet for long before I change. However, if your boots are a tad small like mine and there isn't a bigger size available atm, my tip is to loosen the laces. I untied the boots and retied them a bit looser than when they first came in and my feet feel wonderful now. I'll also be wearing them around the house for a bit in hopes of stretching them out and breaking them in. All in all, I'm very satisfied and happy with my purchase. Will update later how they hold up after a day out.
reviews.review_header: A little small, but I like them

reviews.review_text: These boots are great! I have not had a chance to wear them out anywhere, but just from trying them on and wearing them around the house I can tell they are going to be very comfortable. I am a size 9 normally, but sometimes have to size up for boots. Not this time! They fit just as I hoped and have plenty of room for my toes without them getting squished. I have wide feet, and these are plenty wide for me, even with thicker socks. I lace them up to the second to last rivet thing, and they're not too tight but feel very secure. I was able to layer my jeans underneath no problem, they didn't bunch funny either like jeans often do with boots this height. I will definitely buy these again when my current ones wear out. I highly recommend these boots!
These boots were so cute at first but they are not durable whatsoever. I probably wore them around 3-4 times. :(

Generally quite happy with this purchase! Pros: Very cute! Can't beat the price! Sturdy, fit as expected The lace-up style accommodates wide calves, thick socks, and tucked in jeans I have wide feet and the boots are comfortable at my normal size Cons: Slippery bottoms, best for fall fashion not bad weather conditions Takes a few uses to break in Zipper is decorative, so they can take a few minutes to put on and lace up
reviews.review_header: Generally quite happy with this purchase

reviews.review_text: I'm in love with these boots. They are so cute and I've gotten compliments on them. I knew the zipper wouldn't work from other reviewers but it takes less than a minute to lace them up so I that doesn't bother me. Also I ordered a size 7 and a half although I'm a consistent size 7 because several reviews said they run small. Here's what I found- I can wear them comfortably because I wear extra thick socks from Sept to May anyway. But if I wore regular socks I could've gotten just the size 7.

name: Forever Women's Buckle Strap Block Heel Ankle Booties

reviews.review_text: These are the cuties booties! I have gotten tons of compliments and are super comfortable. I've worn the on a 6 hour flight and lugging a ton of luggage around and feet felt great!

I received these boots as a gift. They are adorable and perfect height! My only complaint is, the heel on the left boot seems a little off??...it's a little woobly when I walk..the right side isn't like that. I didn't return it because I figure after some wear and tear, the heel will probably smooth out. I had received the Tan and Brown and I kept the Tan. The brown wasn't a true brown, it was more of a chocolate brown and in the wrong light, it looked more black than brown. I like the style of these and the ankle is not huge..alot of boots swallow my ankles. I wear size 8& that is what size I have in the Tan..pefect fit. I wear normal width and these boots are great. Below is a pic for those of you to see the difference in the shades..ignore my socks. I love when people give detailed reviews and tell me what color product they ordered so I thought I would do so. On my right foot is the Tan, on my left is the Brown. I kept the Tan as I felt it was a good shade for my wardrobe. I hope this helps.

I LOVE these boots! The quality for what I paid is unbeatable! I got compliments on them all day the first time I wore them out. I would recommend putting some gel inserts in them though, other than that their perfect. They have about a 3 inch heel.
Exactly what I was looking for. Just received today, quality looks very good, especially for the price. I couldn't get a good gauge in the heel height before buying, but they're 3 inches.
reviews.review_header: quality looks very good, especially for the price

reviews.review_text: Pros: True to size (I ordered a 6.5 and it fits exactly as expected.) The shoes appear to be well made - no left over glue or thread anywhere. The dye is consistent throughout the shoe, no blotches. I've worn these for a few weeks now and they're holding up very well. They are of average comfort - about what you'd expect for a boot with a heel. I can wear these for a few hours without complaint. And have I mentioned they're adorable? :) I'm usually leery of things with buckles, but these don't look cheesy and don't have that cheap look I hate. I ordered brown so it goes with almost every outfit I own, which is very convenient. Cons: No real cons I can find. They're a decent price, fit nice, wear well. If I could tell the manufacturer anything, it'd be to add some padding on the heel so I could wear them all day long, but that's what store bought insoles are for. ;)

I really love this small Bootie it's cute and the color Is great , a little Small on my 7 1/2 maybe an 8 would be more Comfortable but it's not Uncomfortable . If You have a wide foot it may not Work for you as it is narrow & snug

I definitely needed a new pair of black booties and these are 'kicking.' I am making myself readjust to wearing heels since during the summer I wear flats more often. Also,even though I am close to 50, there is no way I am going to start wearing 'old lady' shoes and boots (or clothes for that matter.). Love the buckles and they look expensive. They would look fantastic with leggings, but I will need to think long and hard before I take that step. You younger ladies will, no doubt, look fabulous with these booties and leggings.
Weeeelllllll..... the tan looks a little bit faded and they're a bit bulky. They don't hug the ankle like I would've liked. But overall they're still cute.
reviews.review_header: They don't hug the ankle like I would've liked

name: Global Win Women's Fashion Winter Boots

reviews.review_text: I'm in love! I've had my eye on these boots for a while, and I finally spoiled myself. Totally worth it! I have sort of wide feet, and I wear a size US 11. I can't ever find boots in my size or they're too slender and I can't get my foot inside. These boots are awesome. They're definitely not a fast slip on boot and go. The side zipper only goes up half the boot, so they'll need untied and tied for putting on and taking off. Some of the other reviews stated that they're slightly larger in size, and they are. But, that's a good thing... Thick socks can be worn without pinching toes. I have huge calves and they fit with no problem. I have small ankles, so the boots are pretty big in that area, Again not a big deal... Just room for thick socks. I'm 5'10" with fairly long legs (although most of my height is from my torso), and when the boots are unfolded, they come all the way up to the bottom of my knee. The faux fir doesn't run the entire length, but there is a fuzzy soft lining inside and it'll easily keep your feet and legs warm. The box they arrived in, is a perfect square and now that they're out, there's no way I can get them back in. I was surprised it was the boots when I saw the box size. Other than that, I'm very pleased with this purchase, and can't wait to wear them out. I'm gonna have to buy more outfits to wear with them 😃

These are the most comfortable boots I have ever worn, I was hoping that the fur would be all throughout the inside and it’s not but instead there is a super warm wool lining throughout the whole thing I’m super happy about! Soles are super high quality and very sturdy. Super warm and I’m so glad to have these for this winter.
reviews.review_header: Buy a size up from your actual shoe size. That’s what I did and it’s perfect, still have just enough room for some thick socks.

reviews.review_text: I bought these boots specifically for a weekend in New York City that I knew it would be snowing. We walked over 20 miles over the span of 2 days, and the second day it snowed 5 inches. Not one time did my feet feel cold or wet, and I never slipped once despite the very slushy conditions. I was just wearing normal weight socks yet my feet were never cold, but they were never hot either. A perfect temperature. I stepped directly in huge puddles and never even got slightly damp. I HIGHLY recommend these boots. I have flat feet, so my feet ache pretty easily normally. Not one single time did my feet hurt or did anything rub despite my thin socks in these boots. I added a very thin memory foam insert before I ever even wore them because of my flat feet, but it was nothing serious and I still think even without them I would have been very comfortable. I want to buy another pair in black. They are adorable and extremely practical.
reviews.review_header: Wore on a weekend trip to NYC in snow

reviews.review_text: I love, love, LOVE these boots! Okay, did I say I love them yet? These are my absolute favorite boots I own now! I bought these because they're by Global Win and I had previously bought 2 pair of boots from them and loved them as well. Now these are super cute, they fit perfect (even though I have larger than average calves), and I get so many compliments from them, of course the most important thing-they're perfect for winter and they're extremely comfortable to wear!

Nice boots for price. Ordered 1/2 size smaller as per reviews. I m usually a 7 in a boot. Ordered 61/2. WAY to big. Afraid gto order 51/2, I ordered a 6. They are big still. Could have ordered but I will keep 6. Seems to be comfortable and warm. Yes, these are good for large calf girls....... Weather is now bitterly cold. 8 degrees with a further wind chill. Outside for no more than 10 minutes and feet r cold. These are not Pajar’s so they are not really for people who need this kind of gear for real.

If you are like me and can't find tall boots because you have large calves, look no further!! I just received these and they fit perfect! I have ordered other boots with "wide calves" and they never fit! These are perfect because they tie up. The tongue is big enough for larger calves. Love them they look so good and are versatile with the double looks!
reviews.review_header: Finally a nice boot that fits wide calves!!

reviews.review_text: These are cute! Comfy! Be warned though they run a bit big. The ankle area is loose which is a good and bad thing. In order to feel more secure you'll need to wear thick socks. If you have small slim legs this might be a bad thing for you. The good thing is for my ladies with larger legs these should fit you just fine. Plenty of room for large calves. You may have to add thick socks as well to feel secure in the ankle area but it won't be as loose as someone with thin legs/ankles. The bad thing for larger sized calves...I'd say calves 17inches and up there's not enough string to wear the boot in its extended option...higher up the calf. Overall Nice purchase!

Love these boots!! I have larger calves so I have a hard time finding boots that fit right around the calves. I’m in between normal boots and wide calve boots. These are perfect. The laces are long enough to be able to tie if you were them unfolded too. The only downfall so far is that they are, like other reviews state, a little big around the ankle. I haven’t worn them with boot socks yet but I imagine that will help along with breaking them in a bit. I usually wear a 9.5-10, and they only had whole sizes so these are a little big on me but not terribly. I’m 5’8” and these unfolded go up to my knees. Unfolded they sit as high as most other boots I’ve found. **EDIT 12/21/17** it's cold enough now to wear double leggings and boot socks. The boot socks definitely help with the extra space around the ankles!

name: Bearpaw Women's Emma Short Snow Boot

reviews.review_text: I'm writing this review only hours after I got these boots, and I am SO excited to try them out outside in the cold weather! I'm in Madison, Wisconsin, and this week is going to stay in the 30's and even dip into the 20's (Fahrenheit!). I will update this review accordingly, and come back in a couple months to write details on durability when it comes to some real winter weather (hello blizzards and -20 degrees!!). The first thing I noticed out of the box is that they don't have any weird smells, which is great. The outside smell faintly of leather, because that's what they're made of. I looked up the company, and Bearpaw's boots are outside = leather, inside = sheepskin. So if you're thinking about using these in snow like me, we need to waterproof these babies! Luckily I have a spray already to use on them. The inside of these boots is SO SOFT. If I wore these barefoot (which you can, apparently, but for me - ew! I get sweaty feet), my feet would be in heaven. I tried wearing them with bare legs to see how soft it felt (because against your hands it doesn't feel that soft, it's got kind of a soft, but wooly feel to it) and against my legs it felt so fluffy and silky, so airy!! And warm!! None of the color (I ordered Chocolate) has transferred to my socks/pants. Awesome! Also, from ALL the pictures I browsed through on the internet, none of them had any good views of the inner lining. I really wanted to judge how thick it was before I ordered, but since I couldn't find any good pictures, I just trusted the reviews saying that they're warm enough for really, really cold winters. And the lining is decently thick - I'd say it's about an inch thick, although over time it might get compressed a little with constant wear. The soles are a different color wool than the rest (it's white instead of chocolate), but still soft and fluffy. It feels like I'm walking on down pillows, mmmm! I put up several pictures of my boots if anyone is interested - of all angles, including the lining! Here is a link to my video of the boot: [...] Some of the reviews said that after a month or two the lining starts wearing off and comes off on your clothes... The lining looks pretty well made, so I don't know if that will happen, but I will update this review if it does start coming off. Hopefully not... I am really loving these! The bottom of the boots is made of really nice, sturdy but flexible rubber and I can see this really holding up for Wisconsin winters! So excited!! It's as thick as my other winter boots, so that's great news. SIZE: I read so many reviews about what size to order, and it just got confusing. There were pretty much equal amounts of reviews telling you to order down a size, or order up a size. So I went to the Bearpaw website and they suggested ordering up a size... I usually wear a 9.5 exact (no size 9, no size 10), so I decided to order a size 10. It makes sense, because there's a layer of fluff that you have to consider when you think about how much space there is for your feet. The size 10 fits me really well. When I first put them on, they seemed a tad bit small, but after walking around in them for a few hours, they're already form-fitting to my feet. Basically: when you order, think about what your size would be when considering an extra inch of lining around your feet, and also remember that you don't want to order too large, because they do form around your feet after some use (that lining will be squished by your walking!). If you're a half size, order the next whole size like I did. I can't speak for people who have whole sizes because I didn't have that situation, but hopefully a size up won't be too big! On an interesting side note, I think I remember that the Bearpaw website says you can wear these in any kind of weather - and I think that's just weird? How could you wear these on a hot summer day?? These are real winter boots and your feet would hate you for that, hah! **** UPDATE ************************ UPDATE ************************* UPDATE ****************************************** January 2, 2014 So good news everyone! Turns out that the fur lining does NOT rub off on your clothes/socks. I think it kind of did like the second or third day I wore it (probably because it was getting broken in), but it wasn't even that much, and after that it has NEVER happened again. The color never has rubbed off on anything, even in the beginning. So at this point I would DEFINITELY recommend that you DO NOT buy a size up if you can get your exact size. Only order a little up if you have a half size, just because they don't sell half sizes. After breaking them in they really form fit to your feet, so don't freak out if they feel a little tight when you first get them (it's just that the lining hasn't been squished by your feet yet - think of it like getting super fluffy slippers that mold to your feet). The boot itself is holding up phenomenal, it's so worth the money! The rubber sole looks barely touched or scuffed or worn down at all and I've been wearing them daily since I got these (so mid-November til beginning of January at this point). I used them to walk to class every day (a mile or two) and I have been running and tramping through half a foot of snow with them. Waterproofing them helps them keep dry and also miraculously keeps all traces of salt stains off - they literally look like I just got them like last week, it's amazing. As for the stitching on the sides - before I bought them I read some reviews saying that the thread has come apart on the stitching on the outside. So far for me, the stitching has been doing really great - I think there were a couple tiny fly aways at first but it's inconsequential to the strength of the stitches (holding up real well) and no more are occurring over time. So finally the weather has been getting really cold here (this week we are getting -45 degrees Fahrenheit with the windchill factor and several inches of snow), and I never leave the house without these boots! Actually if I wear them inside the house my feet get too warm. These keep me warm no matter what I'm doing (hiking, walking on frozen lakes, walking through snow and wind). Because of these boots, I actually don't care about the weather outside anymore! I never worry about my toes getting cold, which was a HUGE problem with some of my other boots I've had over the years, because even though the boots were thick and sturdy on the outside (hard rubber or leather), they just didn't keep my toes warm. These are life savers for a Wisconsin girl in Winter!! I don't care about people who say they would never buy them because they look like uggs - I bought these for warmth and boy do they deliver. I have always gone for comfort when it comes to apparel and this is going to be a staple of mine if they don't discontinue these for the next few decades.
reviews.review_header: SO SOFT!!! Looks really well made for the price!!!

reviews.review_text: Ordered Jan.18 2016 received Jan. 21 2016 2weeks within the first time my daughter wore it started showing signs of peeling on the bottom of 1 of the boot I Ignored it thinking she might've stepped on something following the second time she wore it to school and came home as you can see from the second and last photo of what had happened I should've returned it with the first signs of the peeling which I gratefully ignored and now I'm stuck with a pair boots which is terribly ruined less than 45 days less then 4 x of used! Sadly this is not our first, second, or third pair of bear Bearpaw boots. I believe this pair which I received was stuck in storage for so long with hot conditions!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.review_header: 21 2016 2weeks within the first time my daughter wore it started showing signs of peeling on the bottom of 1 of the boot I Ignor

reviews.review_text: Bought these for my wife as an x-mas gift. fit was a bit tight in the shaft but stretched out after a few days. After 16 days they tore along the seam on the top of the boot...we put a white piece of paper in them to show the size of the tear they were worn very little not enough to tear so easy. the quality seemed well enough they seemed sturdy up to that point, also I might point out that it was an odd place for them to tear considering you pull them on it seems as though they would have ripped from the back. Amazon was wonderful as always made the return easy and issued a refund as soon as they received the item.
reviews.review_header: we put a white piece of paper in them to show the size of the tear they were worn very little not enough to tear so easy. the qu

reviews.review_text: These boots lasted less than 3 months for me. I have bought this same pair before and they lasted at a minimum the entire fall/winter. But they have slits for grip on the soles and from standard use, the slits have split all the way into the cushion on the bottom of the boots. There is probably a better tread pattern than this one. Update: I submitted a warranty request through Bearpaw on January 10th, they approved the request on 1/16 and now it is 1/25 and I still have no tracking number like it has shipped yet. It may have shipped and I just don't have it yet. But 2 weeks in Ohio winter with no wearable boots is annoying. I don't buy lots of extra shoes, I just buy what I need so I didn't have a backup expect heavy snow boots. I feel like I should have just bought another pair and wrote these off instead of getting the warranty request.
reviews.review_header: Lasted less then 3 months. Then soles split.

name: DEARCASE Women's Long Sleeve Casual Loose T-Shirt Dress

reviews.review_text: This review is for women over 5'4'' because all the pictures on the review were much shorter than I, so it was hard to compare. I am 5'7'' and usually wear a medium but I almost bought a large to ensure that it would be long enough but I'm sure glad I didn't. It was very flattering and comfortable. I got lots of compliments all day.

LOVE this dress! I normally wear an XS/S (5'6", 135lbs, 32D/34C) but did a M based on customer reviews. I wish I had done a S because it's a little big, but I still love it! Will be buying more colors!
Bought a size medium I'm 5,3 and 136lbs fits great!

I want to order this is ALL THE COLORS. it is so flattering. I am 5'2" and weight about 190lbs and I ordered a medium. It fits so comfortably and I'm really glad I didn't order a large. If I was around 10-15lbs slimmer it will probably fit even better but it is so comfy and soft and the perfect length. I love how the hem is asymmetrical!!!
reviews.review_header: I want it in every color

reviews.review_text: Needed a dress for Christmas pictures and love how soft and comfortable it is.

Terrible!!! I ordered 2 of these in the same size! The green one came right and fits as expected! The blue one however is WAY too small and way different than the green one! Way too short fits like a shirt instead of a dress! Very disappointed! 😡 They have different tags is the collar too...was supposed to be the same Dress in two different colors!

I LOVE this dress! The fit is very flattering and the material is the softest thing I've ever had on my body! Planning on ordering this in a couple more colors now. I am 5'7" and 198 lbs and I ordered a size large.

Purchased a medium to wear at 9 months pregnant. I'm 5'5 and 170lbs, I think I could wear this at my normal 145lbs as well. It's a bit short due to my belly on the other side so I paired it with leggings. Super soft and great sleeve length. Considering buying it in another color post baby.

name: Premier Standard Women's Over The Knee Boot - Sexy Over The Knee Pullon Boot - Trendy Low Block Heel Shoe - Comfortable Boot

reviews.review_text: Awesome and totally cute!!!!!! Loved it and I got so many compliments!!!!! ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

Omg, I'm in love. First, these are so comfortable. Not stiff, they're soft on the feet's soles. I have other over the knee boots, but these make you look sexier. The height is perfect. I've been wanting some mid thigh.
Ooh Kay now do not hesitate , it's a true size I'm 5"3 and wear a 7.5 in shoes. It fits perfectly like gloves !! I'm just in love with them !!
I ordered a 1/2 size up so I can wear warm socks and not have any trouble getting the boots up above my pants - worked out great! It may not be a designer boots, but still looks great!

I was so excited for these boots to arrive and they did arrive much sooner than I was told so that was awesome. The first time or two wearing them they were great but they're not something you can wear daily. I'm a US 7.5 and the 7.5 fit much closer to an 8 or an 8.5 in the foot and is extremely small in the ankle/calve area. The boots do stretch a bit at the thigh after a few wears so it's necessary to readjust the string placement pretty much every time you put them on. The heel is extremely high, which has never been a problem for me in the past especially when it comes to boots, but I ended up stretching one of the ligaments in my foot as a result of wearing these for three days in a row. Overall, the fit is big, the heel is high, and they constantly have to be adjusted.

Beautiful boot and True to size but not made for women with larger calves. I’m short with muscular legs. The foot portion fit great but the calf portion of the boot is extremely tight and too uncomfortable to bare. It hugs my calf too tightly. Based on the reviews listed I assumed the leg portion would be able to stretch to my liking and will give me the option to adjust them using the ties. You can see where it’s cutting off my circulation right in the middle. I won’t be able to wear pants with these because of the shape of my legs. I tried them on while wearing thigh high sheer tights and without, still the same result. Makes me really sad that they didn’t work since I really did love this Shoe. Will be returning today and will have to keep looking for this style that will meet my body type.

I ordered these with 1 day shipping and they arrived well within the timeframe needed! (That's the reason for the 5-star review). The boots themselves deserve 4 full stars. They are comfortable, even though I rarely ever wear heels. They didn't have my usual size in the color needed, so I rounded up to the next size and they fit perfectly - with a little extra room for my toes which is what I always look for. The tops of the boots stayed up all night when loosely tied. They are adjustable via the drawstring, which is made of plastic fake leather. The only thing, in my opinion, that looked cheap about the boots was that drawstring and the finish of the very top, which is just stitched like a clothing seam rather than boot stitching. The "natural" color is not an off white as shown, but more of a very light tan. They went really well with ivory leggings & a dark green tunic, although I kept asking my husband if I looked like one of Robin Hood's merry men. :)
i love them 😍😍😍😍😍size 9 color olive

name: Globalwin Women's 17YY12 Fashion Boots

reviews.review_text: Ordering shoes on-line can be a total bummer, but this pair is AWESOME! I read the reviews and ordered accordingly - knowing my fondness for wool socks in winter. I tried them on, walked around the house a couple hours, thought (weirdly) 'these shoes fit just right' and I decided to wear them on my trip to NYC! I brought my backup shoes just in case I was imagining things, knowing that it could go downhill real fast with a lot of walking (which is what I do in NYC). True story - I wore them every single day - all day - from morning (walking) to night in all venues (they look that good) and then some. I never used my backup pair - I lived in these shoes every day. What a lovely surprise to get a great pair of boots that kept my feet warm, had room for wool socks, a generous toe box and no heel slippage. We averaged 13K steps every day and never once did my feet feel cold, crowded, or uncomfortable. Plus - my ankles were warm and shielded from the fierce winds. LOVE these BOOTS!
reviews.review_header: Best Boots I've Walked Miles in!

reviews.review_text: I was kind of sad to see some of the pictures in the reviews from other people hopefully that doesn't happen to my boots so far so good though. I've been wearing them since I got them for Christmas and they've held up really well. I do have to say I Scotch guarded them to help protect them from water with them being swayed. I have worn them in the snow numerous times and I've not had any issues with the sole separating from the boot. They are comfortable and warm for the winter months. I've gotten lots of compliments on them. I'm typically very reluctant to buy shoes online as I've had some bad experiences but this one has been pleasantly surprising.

I bought the camel color on lightening deal for around $17. The color is prettier than I thought it would be. They look much more expensive than I paid. I'm a size 10-11 sometimes wide so I was afraid they wouldn't fit me. I'm also a big girl so my calf is chunky. I'm thrilled I can wear a warm scrunch sock with them with my skinny jeans and still have plenty of room to move. I pull socks straight to put the boot on and zip then I scrunch the rest of the sock. Very cute without being delicate. I bought a size 11 so they probably do run a bit big but that's what I love about them because it's the biggest size available. . .com

I bought these for my daughter. She loved them. They have a great profile. They're a bit large though. They're somewhat wide. Whoever makes this brand is using a men's mold. They're D width. I wear an 8.5. I bought her a 7.5 and I fit in them, although they were a bit snug (would have been comfortable in an 8 for me, 7 for her). I had also bought another model and had the same problem. She liked them enough she didn't want them sent back, so just go to the drug store and get a set of Dr Scholls gels and they'll fit better in the toe box. They're pretty comfortable and are reasonably constructed for their price point. I'm actually liking this brand in general.

I got these with the intention of wearing really thick socks, so I ordered a size up. From what I can tell, I believe they are true to size. I wear them to work with my dress pants and no one can tell I'm wearing boots. But they are so stylish, I might get another pair just to have for going out and wearing with leggings or skinny jeans! I got them during a flash sale, so they were definitely worth the money. I think they are fairly high quality and seem to hold up pretty well. I haven't treated them for winter yet, but I should have and I would recommend you do that if you want them to last longer than one season.
reviews.review_header: High quality for the price - super cute!

reviews.review_text: Super cute boots for a good price. I noticed a lot of the reviews claim these boots run large...I think that is a bit misleading. The length of the boot is average to maybe an 1/8" longer than average and maybe 1/8" wider than your average shoe (wear socks and you'll fine). It's a boot with a hard leather rounded toe and those usually always have a bit more room than your average shoe. I would definitely not recommend buying a size smaller than you normally wear. Buy your size and wear them. Super cute. Would purchase again.
reviews.review_header: Very cute! Order your true size, not a size smaller...

reviews.review_text: These boots are so cute and soft around the ankles. I have huge calfs so longer boots were out of the question but I'm not sad because these boots are actually comfortable!

Was sort of sceptical on ordering these boots. The reviews looked good so I decided to give them a try. I usually wear an 11 or a 12. These only went up to size 11. They came quickly. They are plenty wide enough & the toe box is roomy. I could even wear a thicker sock. They are super cute. Great price too!!
reviews.review_header: Oh my gosh, I love them!!!

name: Quicksilk Denoise NY Men's Waterproof Snow Boots Hiking Boot

reviews.review_text: For a $40 boot I'm impressed. I got these because they look fresh and they said they were waterproof, but honestly I had my doubts about the quality at this price. They're definitely simple in terms of design, no fancy flourishes, they're lightweight and flexible. First time I wore them it was snowing hard and I was slogging around in it for 2 hours My feet never got cold and when I got home my socks were bone dry. I'm sold, and I'm recommending them to everybody.
reviews.review_header: Awesome value for the price; waterproof and comfortable.

reviews.review_text: I wasn't sure what to expect initially, but the other reviews and images definitely swayed me to give this these pair of boots a go. I wanted to find something that was both durable and stylish that I could wear daily- and these definitely filled both of those roles, and went way above my expectations- especially at this price point. - Solid material and make, clean and color was just as displayed from the seller's images. - Surprisingly soft interior. - Comfortable for my everyday wear and go great with my jeans- dark blues and greys. - They fit really well (bought size 11, i normally wear 10.5 - 11.5- just depends on the make), and I have wide/flat feet. Which was my biggest concern, seeing as some/most shoes end up being more narrow and uncomfortable. I think the only think I would have loved to from these would have been it having a thicker insole for more cushion- but that's personal preference. That being said, I'm definitely using the money I saved buying this vs more expensive mainstream brands to buy a comfy insert and toss it in these bad boys. Overall, I really am happy with my purchase.They arrived quickly, well packaged, and are well made. These are a great bang for your buck sort of boots, especially at that price point. I know for sure I'm going to look over their other products and wishlist another pair of these for a future purchase.

This could and perhaps should have been a Christmas gift. While I cannot speak of there ability for hiking they certainly are great for every day walk about in the city. He loved them they are very nice and I feel worth every penny. Now I come to the point in the box I was offered free other things to write a good review. It angered me and it’s whats wrong with the amazon market place. I don’t want to be bribed I want to be reliable.

Arrived within the promised time. The boots are really comfortable and light. I wore them the for entire day to test them out and the comfort was great. I hope they are durable, but so far I like them. I went a size bigger, size 10 instead of 9.5, and it was a good decision. If they are durable I'll buy a different color boot. 02/05/2018 - Update The boots are still comfortable however they scratch up rather easy, which is unfortunate. As such I'm deducting one star 03/08/2018 - update after helping my friend move heavy furniture the sole of on of the boots detached. Also they don't provide great ankle support while moving heavy furniture. Conclusion These boots would fair better for just everyday city walking. Hence I reduced the rating to 3. I used super clue to fix the boot. I know only use them for casual wear.

Ok, so here's the deal. Yes, I've received a lot of compliments about these shoes and for the first 2 months they worked great. However, after using them int he harsh chicago winter I've noticed a lot of design flaws on these. 1. The heel is easily removed - the fabric lifted and the sole was revealed allowing water to sit in the crevices. 2. The insole wears easily and feet are then exposed to the outersole 3. Water enters the sole crevices and then seeps into the insole to the feet and then cannot get out because they have a waterproof housing. So, if you plan on wearing these in any wet conditions - don't. If you plan to stay dry these work great.
reviews.review_header: Great for fashion, bad for wet conditions

reviews.review_text: I’ve had these for about a week and had the opportunity to break them in during the start of Boston winter times. To start they definitely do not look like $30 boots. The stitch quality is nice and the fabric finishes complement the leather very well. While wearing only thin sports socks, my feet were warm and dry while walking around the snow. After a week of wearing them, the boots fit very comfortably and the light creases on the toe make it look even better. Definitely a must try for this price!
reviews.review_header: Great leather shoes at an even greater price.

reviews.review_text: What an awesome shoe, at least on first inspection. Purchased for my son but my husband spied them, tried them on, and instantly wanted a pair. He walked around in them and didn't want to take them off! Frustrating to me as they were intended to be a gift, but it looks like another surprise from Santa will have to be in order.:) The boots are stylish, comfortable, and affordable: a winning combination. I highly recommend them so far. NOTE: My husband is a size 12 and my son is a size 13, but my husband said they felt good, so they may run a tad bit small especially with thick socks. Also be aware these boots have not been worn outside so haven't truly been tested. Will update review as they are put through their paces.

Everyone says these are comfortable but I could not believe it. These are the most comfortable shoes I’ve had in a while, even more so than my running shoes. These boots are also stylish enough to wear out on a casual event or for everyday use without standing out too much. One downside is that it says they’re waterproof but when I tested them with water some of the water leaked insinde the boot, while these are great for a rainy day I would not jump on a river with them My only other complaint is that there need to be more colors!
reviews.review_header: These boots are the real deal !

name: 206 Collective Women's Linden Mid Rain Boot

reviews.review_text: This is a good quality, heavy duty rain boot. I think for the price, this is a great boot. However, I wear somewhere between a tight 7 and a somewhat loose 7.5 and went for the 8 because people said it runs small. However the 8 is too big and slips off my right foot when I walk. Perhaps for other people, this will work but it's just too large. And if you have wide calves, this is a good option for you because it is very wide in my opinion. My feet are regular width and fit fine. Also, it does have a weird smell but it's not a big deal. It's not like your shoes are anywhere near your nose when you're wearing them and it is just that new rubber smell that goes away.

These were true to size and a perfect fit for my narrow heel and high arch. I ordered 7 pair of boots to try on and these were my absolute favorite. I wore them all day with thick wool socks and boot liners and they stood up to everything I did for 10+ hours on my feet. They allow lots of movement and no sliding. Yes, they did have a strong rubber smell — but you don’t notice it too much when you are getting in and out of the car. For the price they are stellar!! Calf is 15.5 wide and they were easy to put on and off. I where a size 10 in boots and they were spot on, granted I have a narrow foot.
reviews.review_header: These are a great buy- super comfy!!

reviews.review_text: If you have a HUGE flood, you need chest waders. But for most episodes of messy weather, these boots will help. For some reason, I realized I didn't have any "Wellies" as I watched people affected by Florence. So I got these as well as a cheapo poncho. Manolos they aren't, but they're a necessary part of a shoe "wardrobe."
reviews.review_header: A good boot for rough weather and mucky days.

reviews.review_text: I have a very narrow size 7 foot. I ordered the size 7 with fingers crossed. The first time I wore them I did have to wear a pair of fuzzy thicker socks but they fit perfectly then. Would not recommend for a wide foot or even on the wide side. It is a TRUE regular width. The rubber is very thick and sturdy. They do not come up to your knee. About 1/2 way up your calf. There is an insole that is removable but it really doesn't give you any more room inside. That's me in the red boots in the pic. You can see the height of the boot.
These are ok. I returned them bc they are so big. I am a 7 and the 7s were too large and made a weird noise when I walked. Very heavy boot, not for an outfit out in town. More for garden work.
reviews.review_header: These are ok. I returned them bc they are ...

reviews.review_text: I like red boots that fit!! I wore no socks and got black feet so heads up wear socks!!! I wear size 7 and ordered a 7 and they got great. Fun boots that you will love.
love these! surprisingly comfortable & the lining is a plus.
They are rubber rain boots that work! good price...
reviews.review_header: They are rubber rain boots that work! good price...

name: 206 Collective Women's Rainier Duck Boot Rain

reviews.review_text: Love my boots. Wore these boots to a trip to Norway in the rainy fall, and they kept my feet dry. Roomy, so I could wear wool socks (which you will need in the winter as the furry lining does not go all the way to the foot area, only where the fabric area is. So I’d say it’s more of a fall boot, as the insulation does not include the foot area. I am satisfied with the boots, and will take them with me to Vancouver (very rainy too!). One thing I don’t like- the rubber is not the toughest quality, the boots were rubbing on something as I worked outside, and that area wore down a little. So these are more fashion than function- if you are going to do tough work.

Just got these in the mail! I was looking for a good rain and snow boot and I stumbled across these. I ordered a size 6 and I noticed that my size was discounted nearly $70! I jumped and bought these immediately and so glad I did. This is a great quality shoe! Especially for $14.
reviews.review_header: How I got them for $14- I have no idea!

reviews.review_text: I ordered a size 8 (normally a size 7.5-8) and they fit perfectly. Got them just in time for a huge rainstorm and they served me well, even when walking through 3-inches of water. The flannel interior is nice but not overly insulated. Hopefully these hold up over time. Great product for the money I paid.
Super cute boots and love the price. The boots are tan on top and dark brown at the bottom. The description says tan/navy, but my daughter loves them anyways so we kept them!
Good item
Live in the PNW, love these shoes. Keeps my toes warm and dry with out killing my fashion.

This is really more than I was expecting from this boot. Size is good and they are surprisingly comfortable for the big rubber molding at the bottom. The lugs give good traction and they keep you dry as long as you keep the puddles below the laces. Not really a hiking boot they still work well on my walk of about a mile to the kids school and a mile back. They clean up easily from any mud and much they pick up along the way. Overall a great addition to the collection as they are cute and functional!

These are super cute and functional. I like the height of the boot as it protects my ankle and keeps water/snow from getting into the boot. The boots are completely waterproof. They're a little slick if you're walking in snow, but that's true of most rain type boots. They have good grip in the mud. Since the boots aren't insulated, I got these in a size larger than I normally wear as I wanted to be able to wear thick socks to keep my feet warm in this crazy winter weather. I have narrow ankles, and I was able to tighten them comfortably with the laces.

name: The Fix Women's Sutton Round Toe Ankle Boot

reviews.review_text: Beautiful boots! I wear a size 9.5 or 10 and bought both the magenta and the navy in 9.5. The fit is a bit roomy but not enough to warrant sizing down in my opinion. The colors are rich, the navy is a very dark blue and the magenta is not too red or pink but truly magenta. I hesitate to call any high heels as comfortable but I was pleasantly surprised to find these easy to walk in. Wish they were available in more colors!
reviews.review_header: Roomy but not too big fit.

reviews.review_text: If there ever was a perfect woman's boot, this would be it. My wife loved The Fix Sutton Round Toe Ankle Boot the moment she set eyes on them. Initially she had reservations about trying on the two inch high heels as she couldn't imagine that they would be comfortable or practical. Thankfully, not only do they fit like a dream but they look hot on her! The chunky heel is the key to comfort and stability and the plush upper makes this ankle boot a class act beauty! The velvety material shimmers and looks fantastic with boot cut jeans. I think these trendy boots would work for a wide ranging demographic as they are exceptionally comfortable for a 2" chunky heel and have an understated class that needs no explanation. This is a gorgeous boot that elongates the legs and provides a slimming effect in the process. They are easy to slip into and zip up. My wife has been pleased with the Fix shoe brand, but the Sutton Round Toe Ankle Boot is an instant favorite. They arrive in a nice box with an optional storage bag enclosed. Very nice packaging! ~ Kort

These are such nice looking boots, they are stylish and comfortable. I like the soft blue velvet feel. I was thinking I would not like the heel but I did not have any fatigue after wearing these for hours.

I wear and 8.5 and ordered my size. They are a great fit. The color is vibrant and beautiful in person. The picture does not do them justice. I'm glad I ordered them before the price went up. Can't beat it for less than $10.
Love them
Beautiful
Great fit, very cute, comfortable on my first wearing

name: The Fix Women's Becca Pointed Toe Sock-Style Ankle Boot

reviews.review_text: very comfortable and nice looking.
The boots are extremely pointy. Look like elf boots. I will be returning them
Need every color they heel height is perfect I walked in them all day without any issues kitten heel but still sexy ASF I highly recommend
Beautiful pair of boots and very comfortable straight out of the box. Fits my skinny calves like a glove.
reviews.review_header: Perfect for skinny calves and ankles

reviews.review_text: The Perfect boot. LOVE THEM.I have ordered every color..you should make more colors

Beautiful! Loved the dark green velvetine material. Wanyed to keep these after trying probably 6 pair of similar style. Two cons keep them from being in my closet. 1. Super hard to get on! 2. Heel height..description stated 3" heel however they are more like 3 1/2"..may not seem like much but for me I just can't do it. I've tried several Fix brand items while well being ade & very good looking..just dont bvb work with my foot..but that's no deduction from the company. I'll keep trying!
These shoes are AMAZING!!!!

I paid less than $13 for these green velvety boots. They are everything I dreamed they would be. So glad that I found them and ordered them when I did. I ordered half size larger to be safe. Best purchase ever.

name: Wells Collection Womens & Girls Slouchy Wonda Boots Soft Flat to Low Heel Under Knee High

reviews.review_text: These are just as cute as they look in the pictures. The only "negative" I have is that it's a bit tight on my calves. So if you have big calves just be aware of that. They are super comfortable, even around my calves.
reviews.review_header: Comfortable but a bit tight on calves

reviews.review_text: I had these same boots many years ago from Wet Seal and I LOVED them and I was so sad when they died. These are not the most high-quality boots and the price reflects that. However, people ask me about them all the time and they go with everything. They are ridiculously comfortable and I would repurchase again. BTW this boot is SODA brand not "WONDA" or whatever.

Good boots for the price. Definitely cheap feeling so I am not sure how long they will last. But they are super cute and comfy. I usually wear a size 8 and ordered 8.5 as suggested by other reviews and the 8.5 fits perfect. I highly recommend for a quick and cheap boot, just know you are getting what you pay for. But if that’s okay with you, then these are great. UPDATE: I have had these boots for a few months now and they have held up! I am really impressed with them for the price!!
reviews.review_header: Cheap but super cute and comfy

reviews.review_text: I bought two pairs of these boots in size 6 to wear with my Steampunk costumes, and am pleased with them. They are attractive and lightweight, perfect with knee-high hosiery or thin socks. Although I wouldn't expect them to hold up to heavy use, they seem to be well-made and are quite soft and comfortable. The zipper goes all the way down almost to the sole, making them very easy to get on and off. My only complaint is that, while the "sueded" versions (such as olive and black-23) fit perfectly, the smooth-finish versions (such as black-24) seemed to run about a half-size too small. But after seeing both finishes, I prefer the look of the "sueded" ones anyway!

I am thrilled with these boots! I wasn't expecting much since the price was so low, but I was happily surprised. These boots are light and like wearing bedroom slippers. And the material is soft. The boots don't look cheap in any way, as I was expecting. The zipper works well. I put an inner sole in for a little support, but without it is like being in bare feet which is okay too. I bought them for a trip where I will be hiking during the day but going to nice dinner places at night and these will be perfect to wear at night to comfort my feet and look good. The weight is also perfect for packing. I'm only giving them a 4 because of the lack of support, and I felt the need to add a supportive inner sole. But other than the support, I recommend these boots!

I bought these to wear indoors while working. They are mostly very comfortable and light weight. The length, however, it a bit short. Size 7 usually fits me with a little room but my toe bumps the end. Since they are fairly soft and flexible, it's not too much of a problem. A larger size would be too big.
reviews.review_header: Run a little short but comfortable.

reviews.review_text: Fits great!! Was perfect for the costume I needed these for and have continued to use for fall. Knocked off a star because after two days of wearing them the cognac color already wore off in a very noticeable spot on the front of the shoe. Also, zero foot support - buy a Dr Scholl's one and you're set. For $20 I can't say I expected much but am pleasantly surprised.
The boots are very comfortable. However, the sole of the boots do not have any grip. Must be very careful in walking on certain types of floor
reviews.review_header: The boots are very comfortable. However

name: VALOLIA Women's Pullover Hooded Sweatshirt Long Sleeve T Shirt Color Block Thin Tunic Top with Pockets

reviews.review_text: Love this tunic! Fabric is soft and medium weight. I typically wear medium-large and decided to order large to be safe because I have bigger arms. If not for my arms, I could’ve gone with a medium but the large isn’t overly big. I ordered orange and the color is great for fall—not bright but a beautiful pumpkin color. For reference, I’m 5’ and 150 lbs. Length is perfect with leggings. Plenty of flare to hide my belly and bottom without like a tent. The sleeves are about 24-25” long. For me, that’s about 1-2” too long but the cuffs keep them in place. Definitely a keeper!

This is an updated review. I got the wine color sweatshirt in large and, while very cute, it seemed almost too swingy at the bottom and I was considering a return. Valolia reached out with a very nice customer service offer and I decided to keep it. Once washed the swinginess calms down:) I just can’t say enough about Valolia’s excellent customer service! They’re great!

Clothes never fit me anymore ... generally I just buy whatever is fairly cheap and don’t waste time trying things on because it’s too much effort for very little satisfaction. This, however, fits perfect. It’s big enough for my reconstructed boobs but still fits in the shoulders. It’s also plenty long and easily slides over my hips. The only downside for me: I can get too hot if I try to do anything requiring exertion while wearing this. Since that is my new norm, I will deal with that by being lazy when I put this baby on.
reviews.review_header: Best fitting shirt I own these days.

reviews.review_text: I returned it. I ordered a size up per other reviews, but since it "just fit" and was priced kind of higher than my preference, I returned it. If it shrank in the first wash, I would have been really upset to pay so much and only wear it once. So, I returned it. The color was nice. I think it made my large bust seem even larger, so the big boobed ladies might want to take that into consideration if that's a thing for you.
reviews.review_header: The color was nice. I think it made my large bust seem ...

reviews.review_text: nice enough shirt but had to return as was too big...I am typically a sz 16 xl-xxl depending on brand. I also tried the xl but was too small. I might have kept the xxl but the shoulders were much to wide...I find that alot on imports especially. Their clothing designers seem to think larger women have extra wide shoulders (and very loooong arms) which is not usually the case lol.
reviews.review_header: nice enough shirt but had to return as was too ...

reviews.review_text: I REALLY like this top. It is a bit large, but if you like things that fit loosely, just order your normal size. A bit more fitted you probably want to order down a size. It is nice and warm for the Minnesota cold. It's pretty soft too, and good quality. Looked great with leggings!

Fits great! Well made. Perfect thickness of the fabric for the style. Washes really well. I dry just enough to get out the wrinkles then I hang to dry. I bought it in 2 colors. Cute with leggings and jeans. I highly recommend this top.

This top is extremely comfortable. The fit is really lovely, though it could be a bit more snugly cut and be more flattering. It runs really big, though. I'm 5'5" and 160 and ordered the L, but I'd definitely go for the M next time. I won't return it because it's so dang comfortable! But beware, it does look a bit frumpy when ordered too large due to the location of the pockets on the hips. So order a size down to get a sleeker look, I'm assuming.
reviews.review_header: This top is extremely comfortable. The fit is really lovely

name: Sorel Women's Phoenix Moto Boots

reviews.review_text: Amazing! Super comfortable and no breaking in period necessary. Needed half size bigger for sock accommodation.

name: UGG Women's W Classic Short Sequin Fashion Boot

reviews.review_text: i love the sparkle on my boot. i love how one minute it can be black and another color the next. they are very comfy and i will be ordering another pair!!!
I love these boots !! They are everything!! But my sequins came off !! I’m returning for another pair because I love them just that much
I loved these boots, but they are too small for me. Unfortunately I needed to ship them back. Otherwise, they are so lov

less than 3 minutes... Fantastic way to apply from mobile device. Thank you amazon !!!
