name: Sorel Women's Explorer Joan Boots

reviews.review_text: Suuuuuper warm perfect for Wisconsin weather. I need soemthing to throw on and these are easy on easy off
reviews.review_header: Suuuuuper warm perfect for Wisconsin weather

reviews.review_text: These boots are extremely soft and comfortable. I am size 7-7.5 and went with 7.5 to have room for socks. However, the wine colored boots are more of a raspberry color so I returned them for the tan. The wine color is pretty but I hoped for a maroon. Overall love the boots.
reviews.review_header: Wine is not the color shown, boots are great

reviews.review_text: Fit snug but likely to stretch some overtime. Warm and comfortable which is exactly what I was looking for. Can’t wait to wear.
Very warm, very comfy even though mine are a tad smaller than I thought. I love them, they're very cute.
I sized up a half size and these are perfect! (Normally wear 7 1/2 and got an 8. They are comfortable and warm. Love them!
These boots are so comfortable! Wore them walking around all day and my feet still felt like I was walking on clouds. Super warm too
So comfy! Order half size up. Like wearing slippers all day ❤️

I wish I could wear these boots everyday! They are a beautiful design and extremely comfortable. As a teacher, I am constantly on my feet (in uncomfortable shoes most of the time!) and getting to wear these boots on the weekends is heavenly for my poor feet! They are durable and waterproof and well worth the money. I’d recommend these to anyone who needs to give their feet a break from their office shoes.
reviews.review_header: Wish I could wear these everyday!

name: Sorel Women's Out n About Plus Boots

reviews.review_text: I really like this boot because it is light in weight, making it easy to wear for hours. I normally wear a 9 in sneakers and boots, but the 9 was so small I sent it back for a 10, which is perfect. First time I’ve ever worn a 10, and I wanted to share the advice to go up a size.
reviews.review_header: Good boot, but caution on the sizing

reviews.review_text: CONS: Boot has very little padding between the thin insole and the ridged bottom sole. Feels like walking on rocks Fits a full size small. Has very little shape from left foot to right. Yes, they look like duck feet. Very little arch support, if any. Not cushy inside at all! PROS: They're cute. I purchased mine from a different site. No, I do not recommend these AT ALL.
Fit perfect exactly what we wanted

The size 7 was a bit too snug and just barely rubbing on my toe, while wearing pantyhose thin socks. Enough to be uncomfortable while walking. I own another pair of Sorel boots in a size 7 that fit exceptionally comfortable with thin or thick socks. Unfortunately, all the reviews saying to say up were indeed correct. Gorgeous shoes! I sized up to 7 1/2 for the perfect fit!

I baught these for a trip to Iceland to double as a hiking/rain boot and absolutely love hem! Super comfortable and kept me feet warm. I am not a huge joker so I wanted to make sure I baught a boot that would double as a winter snow boot too- they were perfect for hiking and obviously snow boots in the cold Wisconsin winter! Highly recommend!

Sized-up a full size (perfect fit with thicker, warm socks), and plenty of room in the toe box. Relatively light/great feel vs heavy, clunky duck boots. Only reason for four vs five stars is rigid upper boot around my ankles (which just had to break-in). The camel variety is brown and dark slate (not navy and not black) — very happy with this color scheme in-person.
reviews.review_header: Size-Up/Camel is plus Slate (Does Not Look Navy)

reviews.review_text: Great product. Sorel never disappoints!
My new favorites

name: UGG Women's Bailey Button II Winter Boot

reviews.review_text: Great boots. I checked on UGG website and they are authentic. I believe they are true to size. I would advise against buying a size smaler, as suggested by the description. These are my first UGG boots. So far I am very happy with them.

Less than one year old and the toe of the left boot has a hole in it! I bought these boots as a Christmas gift for my wife, she wears them only as slippers in our house. She is not “hard” on her clothing or shoes, but now there is a hole in the toe of the boot. I thought UGGs were quality built, not this model the uppers are obviously substandard and can’t get manufacturer or seller to stand behind there product!!!!! Very disappointing

God I love these boots. I was slow to let myself accept the joy of Uggs and scoffed at them from afar for years, but then there was an unseasonable cold snap, and I had a gift voucher for Amazon, and I let myself fall down the big & ugly snuggly footwear rabbit hole. I ain’t coming back. These are surprisingly fashion-forward: I think it’s the button on the side and fur at the top, but they don’t look as boxy as the original ones. I got black, because it’s the only color I wear, and I haven’t been disappointed at all. I’m embracing this new me who unashamedly wears leggings and long, asymmetrical tunics and fuzzy Uggs. I’ve started adding drapes scarves in various black prints fur a little splash of, well, not color exactly, but pattern, maybe? Anyway, these are lovely, comfy warm boots and I don’t regret a damn thing about them. They did lose a button but I was able to get a pack of replacements on eBay and reattach with little fuss. Get ‘em. They’re great.
reviews.review_header: Comfy and cute—from a reluctant Uggs convert.

reviews.review_text: I am returning these. These do not seem authentic!!! The fit is waay too large and the sole has a weird feeling when walking on non-rug surfaces. They also had poor seams that had string pieces hanging off. I've had several pairs of Uggs over the years and the ones that are 3-4 years old are better than these.
reviews.review_header: Possibly not authentic, too big, bad sole

reviews.review_text: Very upset!!!! Bought these for Xmas my girlfriend, she loved them, Christmas success. I was initially skeptical about ordering these through Amazon and not Nordstrom because of a potential return and not sure if they are knock-offs. I wish I had got them through Nordstrom. April 14th, she pulled them on and the material ripped open on the side. Are you freaking kidding me!!!!! She’s had at least a dozen pair through the years and never has there ever been this type of problem. Clearly the “uggs” being sold here are of a suspicious quality, or UGG themselves are feeling the economic pinch and going with poor material or craftsmanship, crapping on the consumer like so many other companies. I’m pissed that the return policy through Amazon expired way back in January, and I’m pissed about the disconnect between a manufacturer and Amazon customers. It seems like a company can put inferior products on Amazon and charge the same premium price. I feel like I got double teamed on this purchase by UGG and Amazon both, and my only recourse is to tell my girlfriend “oh well”. This is the worst transaction I’ve made on Amazon. I had hoped to give it zero stars but I guess they did last for a couple months so maybe one star is fitting. After checking them out it seemed pretty clear that these were made much more poorly than the other pairs she has. What a disgrace. I’ll add a photo when she gets home later.

I love Uggs. Turns out, so does my mother-in-law, because she asked for a pair for Christmas. After seeing this specific style, the Bailey Button II, she fell in love and wanted a pair of her own. So we splurged and got them for her for Christmas. I was pleased to receive them in their lovely original box, packaged in white tissue paper. We'd ordered her the black, size 8. She reports they fit perfectly and were immediately comfortable. The fur inside is nice and soft, perfect for keeping your feet warm. I noticed while she was wearing them that they came up about a quarter way up her shin. So just know that these are not the knee-high type of Uggs, nor are they sitting at the ankles, just somewhere in between.

These are the best boots ever. I have actually bought two more pairs of Uggs since purchasing this pair. However, this pair remains my favorite. I have often thought about buying Uggs, but have always hesitated because of the price. These were my first pair, and they are SO worth it. I am on my feet A LOT for my job, and these boots make you feel like you are walking on pillows all day. They are so comfortable! The reason I bought this style was because I wanted to be able to tuck jeans down into the boots. This boot, with the button, definitely allows you to do that WITHOUT the jeans bunching up around the top of the boot. You will not regret buying these boots. They are the best!!!
reviews.review_header: These are the best boots ever

reviews.review_text: Make sure you like the looks of these things before you buy them for someone you live with. You are likely to see them a lot. I gave a pair to my wife, and I don't believe she has worn any other footware in the two weeks since then. Based on her comments, I expect to continue to seem them on her feet until spring. Are they overpriced? Yes, they are overpriced. Make sure the person you give them to knows that so you score maximum points.
reviews.review_header: Wife is thrilled and will not take them off

name: UGG Women's Sienna Matte Rain Boot

reviews.review_text: Love the warmth and comfiness of the wool on the bottom.
Love them
These boots are the best...noway are you getting your feet wet with these boots...you can be outside all day and that will never happen...warm, but not too warm...just the perfect boot!!!!
The quality appear great but this boot size runs too big so I returned it. Guess a smaller size is a better fit . If you’re a US 7 get a 6 instead .

I have 4 pair of UGG boots all of which are very comfortable. I expected these to be the same. I have narrow feet but these were difficult to get on and extremely difficult to get off. The instep was very tight. Although the bed had lining in it I felt like I was standing in the bed of a truck. I'm in the process of returning them.

name: UGG Women's Sienna Rain Boot

reviews.review_text: Arrived quickly & color is great.
I was hoping these would be a little less roomy around the ankle area, but they are huge. I loved the boots, but the fit just isn't for people with thin legs... :( had to return.
reviews.review_header: If you have thin ankles, there are way too big

name: Sam Edelman Women's Kinzey Fashion Boot

reviews.review_text: I expected these to be a tapestry-like material, but instead it is a shiny/glittery-type material which make them a little too 'fancy' for my taste. If you are looking for something very dressy, these would be a great choice for you.

Very cute, decent comfort in the foot due to the lower heel height. HOWEVER, i wore these for a full day today and they scratched the heck out of my ankles. The shape and height of the ankle opening is such that it rubs on my skin at the ankle when I walk. OUCH. Probably won’t be able to wear these again.
Beautiful, comfortable boot! Love them!

Love these ankle boots so much. True to size fit, beautiful leopard print, and love the heel size. They are very comfortable and complement any outfit. They are really cute and every time I wear them I get many complements. I want to order the other available patterns since these ankle boots are so perfect.
LOVE them! Tons of compliments. Very comfortable. Great accessory to make your outfit pop!

Love this black suede bootie, so chic yet with a nice low heel for comfort. I normally wear a 7.5 M but some brands due to their sizing I need an 8 M. Sam Edelman is definitely one of those brands so think about sizing up 1/2 size for maximum comfort. So glad I purchase this bootie.
reviews.review_header: Size up 1/2 size for comfort... otherwise very Chic and comfortable.

reviews.review_text: This was a great fitting, real suede boot. Although it fits and looks great, the heel is about 1" taller than I find comfortable for work. However, it's so beautiful, I'm hanging on to it to see if I can make it work..
I usually order a half size up so the 8 was perfect. I especially like the bootie and am a fan of the kitten heel. Very pleased.
reviews.review_header: ... order a half size up so the 8 was perfect. I especially like the bootie and am a ...

reviews.review_text: The invoices are extremely confusing and when we go to pay it is for items we purchased a few months prior which normally isn't bad, but can be when we get to the end of the fiscal year. Also the first page tends to list more items then what the total payment due box says which is confusing. Only list on that page what has to be paid for. Lastly, for our account purposes we need the itemized invoice for what is being paid for in the current invoice. Currently I have to find the previous months invoice to get the itemized list so I can pay the current month's invoice. So in other words, the amount that is due should also have the itemized invoice in the following pages in addition to the other active charges. I can't pay for an item if I can't code it in our budget and I shouldn't have to flip between different invoices from different months to figure it out. Keep it simple. These are the only invoices I have ever seen created in such a convoluted way. Every other invoice I handle is clear about what is being paid for accept this one.
reviews.review_header: ... we purchased a few months prior which normally isn't bad, but can be when we get to the ...

reviews.review_text: While the credit line is a convenience, the invoicing as it is handled by the third-party servicing provider is cumbersome to use. Product descriptions are truncated on the purchase detail provided. This makes it necessary for me to frequently take the extra step to research our purchases on our account in order to be able to code them. There is no total provided on the statement, again adding an extra step so I can be sure I am paying the correct amount. Since I opened the revolving credit line knowing it needed to be paid in full each month, I don't understand the point of checking off the boxes next to each purchase in order to be sure they are credited to the account. I feel with the sophisticated and impressive technology typically employed by Amazon, this style of invoicing is....inconsistent.
reviews.review_header: While the credit line is a convenience, the invoicing ...

reviews.review_text: Even though both my SS and DOB are correctly entered I kept getting the same below as encountered by other reviewers. Error message: "Your response to following fields is invalid Date of Birth can not be less than 8 characters. Social Security Number can not be less than 9 characters."
reviews.review_header: Don't waste your time filling out the form!

reviews.review_text: An absolute must for businesses, churches, etc. I pastor a small church which has a relatively low maximum on our business credit card. Amazon's corporate credit line gave me a very generous maximum credit line, allowed us to be sales tax exempt because we are a non-profit, and it is so simple to make a purchase. We can either use a P.O. Number or just our line of credit. A nicely detailed statement comes in the mail and I verify and approve it and turn it over to our treasurer/accountant for payment. I love it! Easiest way to purchase what we need, receive it with Amazon's always speedy shipment, and settle up when the statement comes in. If you have a church or business and don't have this you are missing out.
reviews.review_header: A nicely detailed statement comes in the mail and I verify ...

reviews.review_text: The site does not work I too am having problems all fields are correct. It comes back and says that SS need to be 9 numbers. Then it says that the Birthdate has to be at least 8 numbers. It does not show any errors but never able to complete the application online.

I like the convenience of ordering things and paying in full. I do not like the way it is set up however. There is an order number when you order but on the credit card statement there is an invoice number and nothing to tie the two together except the amount and listed items. This makes it hard to reconcile the orders with the bill. It takes too much time to figure out. The billing seems to be lag behind quite a bit. We only pay bills once a month so it makes it difficult to make sure all invoices are paid. The statement doesn't reach us until after the deadline for our monthly bills.
reviews.review_header: love the convenience, BUT not the billing cycle

reviews.review_text: It's the easiest way to to have a business account associated with your personal account. This way you can pick and choose which account you want your purchase charged to. Only annoying thing is that the "Corporate" option will not show up as a payment option unless you choose the business address for delivery. I understand that's a security feature to protect against fraud but in our situation it's unnecessary and an annoyance. Other than that, no complaints.

Wish there was a mechanism to have items categorized, such as book, video, video game, office supply, etc. Even if I could input that information when I ordered, it would help with my budget. As it is, I need to go through every invoice (lots) and try to determine which it is and then, if I can't remember, I need to look it up. It is essential to have this broken down for line items within our budget.

name: GLBALWIN Women's Twisted Rider Fashion Boots

reviews.review_text: I wanted a pair of boots I could practically live in. FOUND THEM! I have bigger calves than a Supermodel so boots like these never fit. These are amazing. I can tuck my pants if I need to without being uncomfortable. These boots are comfortable! They also look totally bad @$$!!!

As a woman with bigger calves it’s sometimes hard to find something cute that’s not stretchy material. These boots fit like a glove and are very comfy since they have a cushy insole which many boots of this style don’t always have. I don’t have a very wide foot, but they’re roomy enough if you have a little bit of a wide foot. I’m now ready for brown boot season lol!!

I absolutely love these boots! The material is really nice and doesn’t look cheap or like vinyl. They fit perfectly! I wear a size 10 but in a lot of shoes I have to get an 11 to get a comfortable fit. These are perfect. Another huge plus for us girls with big feet, is that they make your feet look pretty small. You won’t regret this purchase!

reviews.review_text: The boot is sooooo cute, great material and make. Only thing is it’s for girls with a wider calf. I’m super thin and these were like hoola hoops around my Legs! So sad to return
Going to be my fall go to boots. Super cute. Comfortable!!! Fits perfect. Great price!!!

I loved the unique looking style on these - so of course I had to try out every color 😂 in person, I noticed that the tread on the bottom looks “motorcycle boot” and from the front my husband says they look like a “western boot”. That being said, still worth the purchase to add a unique style to the wardrobe. I’m normally a 9 in boots and these fit great!
I little big even after buying the size suggested by the chart but I will use very thick socks other than that I love how the boots look .
Love these boots! So cute and comfortable. The top is wide and I love that. I doubt they last a super long time but for the price I’m very happy. I would order them again.

name: Globalwin Women's Marion Fashion Boots

reviews.review_text: Ok, looking back at the description now I guess I missed the last bullet point that says the zippers are for decoration only, because seriously, who puts decoration only zippers exactly where it would be super convenient to have real zippers?!? I'm not taking any stars off because of the fake zipper because that's my fault, it was in the description. I am taking one star off because the shape of the boot doesn't compensate for the fact that there's no zipper, so you have to loosen the laces 3-4 eyelets down to the ankle to get them on, and the laces are those stiff kinda plasticky feeling ones that don't slide through the eyelets at all and don't stay tied. Definitely going to get some fabric or soft leather laces. Other than that they're comfy and the fit is spot on. I was literally just trying them on when a tree fell on our house, I ran outside, and forgot that I was even wearing them. I ended up wearing them for about 4 hours climbing up and down a steep hill hauling branches and logs, and they were totally comfy and supportive the whole time. I did have to retie them several times though...

Unbelievably comfortable! Could walk around town all day and feet wouldn't hurt! I am a 9, always order a half size up and did the same here and they are perfect. If you have wide feet, and like being comfortable, these are the shoes for you! Some have complained about them not lasting but at this price, I am happy to replace them every year or two! My feet are grateful.
reviews.review_header: My wide feet are unbelievably grateful!!

reviews.review_text: Saw these and needed to replace an old worn out pair I had. These fit well and comfortable and supportive for me. Only thing is I was looking for a functional zipper and these are decorative but it's fine because they are still fairly easy to put on. The laces are slightly waxy which often leads to them becoming undone but that's an easy fix I'll just replace the laces. The grip on the bottom is really nice. These are the second pair of boots I have purchased from this company and I enjoy their shoes a lot. They are inexpensive yet last a fairly long time when taken care of, I also spray mine with water repellent (2-4 years) and being that I'm rough on my shoes, that's really good. Having to spend $40 dollars for a new pair every fours years is not bad on ones budget. Good quality thanks.
Love the color and style so much!! little bulkier than expected but the leather quality is great so over time the fit will wear into shape.

name: I Could Pee on This: And Other Poems by Cats

reviews.review_text: Only a cat could have written this treasury of cat-think. Poetry and prose certain to entertain and amuse every cat lover. Even the human ones. The book is a small hard-cover that fits on a table without taking up a lot of space. Easily knocked to the floor. Repeatedly. Type is large enough for a geezer (like my person) to enjoy even in less-than-adequate light. Cat portraits showing our furry brethren in cute and/or compromising poses illustrate the pages. While reading the poetry I keep saying, "Just like Mystery" or "Just like Sparx" or "Just like Pogo", etc. I enjoyed it very much and trust that everyone will. 2 dewclaws up!
reviews.review_header: Purrfect for the cat-lover you love

reviews.review_text: Mr. Marciuliano, Catzilla would like to have a word with you. See that "Say What? You're kidding me!" look on his face in this picture? He wants to talk to you about your poem, "One Day." He says, "you may be funny, and you may know a few things about cats, but let me tell you. You are right that we are not equal, but every feline knows who's really in command, and we don't need to wear the pair of your slacks we just peed on to prove it. And seeing as we can reduce you silly humans to a pile of gibberish with a nonstop flood of puddles or aromatic piles, the people who feed us will *never* be our equals, and we cats know who's really in command here." So, Catzilla's comments aside, because yah, he totally wears the Emperor's hat in this house, and should we ever doubt it, he sends his sidekick, Sith Whispicus out to reinforce his demands...this is a funny book, if you've ever had a cat with a touch of the spiteful in him. Cough *Catzilla*. And mostly, I think the author gets it right. I bought this book for my daughter, but I did some reading myself when it came in today because when I had looked at the on-line preview, it made me laugh. And I always like a good laugh. I do have to say though, my favorite cat humor book remains "A Cat's Night Before Christmas," by Beard/Jones/Boswell. It used to leave me gasping for air every time I read it, until it became my daughter's favorite book as a toddler. And we read it over, and over, and over because that's what toddler's do. And being able to quote it from memory allows me to breath when it's read, but I can still smile when thinking about it. So that's a good one to try too, and very on point if you're a cat owner. But otherwise, I thought this one was funny in a more artsy kind of way, and I know my daughter is going to love reading it as well.

Just received "I Could Pee on This: And Other Poems by Cats" today and have already finished it, wiping the tears of laughter as I went along. This is the perfect gift for the cat lover in your life, although it isn't necessary to be one to find the book thoroughly delightful and laugh-out-loud funny. Kudos to Francesco Marciuliano and his brilliant wit. He has a fan for life!
reviews.review_header: No need to be a cat lover to thoroughly enjoy this one!

reviews.review_text: This is a cute book, and enjoyable. Love the photos, and most of the poems. Though some are a bit of a stretch, it's all in good fun. I recommend this to all my cat-loving friends as a pleasurable half hour or so. I'm going to get this in the printed version for my son and his kids, cat-lovers all.
reviews.review_header: A goofy, guilty pleasure worth the time and the money

reviews.review_text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for a friend who's a super cat lady. I love cats also and thought I'd read it before storing it away for Christmas. The poetry is so very boring. I read about 1/3 of the way through so far and am very disappointed that I spent my money on it. I'll still give it to her, perhaps she'll like it better than I. The pictures are really cute, though it's very hard for a kitten/cat pic to not be cute and that is the 1 star rating. I wouldn't recommend this book at all.

The silent war between cats and humans has been going on for thousands of years. The key reason it continues is because we don't know enough to surrender. In part this is due to cats' cleverness. They have kept the battles at such a low level, we don't know the war is going on. It rages silently, below our radar. The author of "I Could Pee on This" is breaking the news to those who have been ignorant in their bliss. The cats have won. They are in charge. You don't believe it? Well, who's the one cleaning the litter box? Francesco Marciuliano knows cats. From feline typewriter fixation to toilet paper destruction to shattered wineglasses, the man has suffered––as have we all––at the paws of cats. And for the love of the diabolical little suckers, he––as do all we cat captives––keeps coming back for more. See "This Is My Chair" for your Cat's attitude towards property rights, "Busy, Busy" for cat sleeping habits. "I Run" reveals a cat's intense desire to appear to know what he's doing. "Tripped" and "Talk to Me" reveal your cat's devious nature and possible criminal intent. In "Kneal (sic) before Me" the true nature of Cat/human relations is revealed. "Nudge" has been my own personal experience with five cats over 60 years, so that one is absolutely dead-on right. Blush at "Man's Best Friend" because it's probably true. "Family" is very likely true––you aren't that important. Every cat is the center of his own universe. You are just a satellite. "I Lick Your Nose" is so true that I've bought thicker makeup to cover scratch scars from the cat who repositions me to suit his favored sleeping spots during the night. This is done by digging into my cheek or eye socket and pulling. When accomplished during REM sleep, I don't discover Rowdy's act of violence until I wash my face in the morning. And, of course, the title piece says it all: Your cat will dominate you at every turn. I laughed all the way through "I Could Pee on This," often reading pertinent verses to my husband as we lay in the dark, me reading my Kindle, he drifting off to sleep. He didn't always react as I would have hoped. I'm hoping it was because he was half-asleep. I've converted him to being a cat person. But does the dog person in him still prevail? Rowdy, Jeep, Liam, Smokey and I must get together and work on him. If forty-two years of cat domination haven't quite converted him yet, we'll have to take more drastic action.... KL
reviews.review_header: In the war between cats and humans, the cats have prevailed

name: Cats

reviews.review_text: This recording of CATS features the original London cast, headed by Elaine Paige and Brian Blessed. Because it is the first official full-length recording of CATS, this does not always mean that the world-premiere rendition is always the best. The London cast gives a fairly adequate performance of the score, and perform it with a softer-grained approach as compared to their Broadway counterparts. And the lean-textured recording has sounded even better than before with this recent digital remastering. Elaine Paige may be acknowledged as a foremost interpreter of Grizabella, but here her performance shows that she neds some time to get into the spirit of the role. She does give a fine rentition of Memory that, despite competition from Betty Buckley, allows her to hold her own. Brian Blessed gives a firm, commanding and sonorous portrayal of Old Deuteronomy. He has a convicting voice that he demonstrates to great effect in his solos, even in his powerful Ad-Dressing of Cats. The lower-level principals don't seem to fare that well. Wayne Sleep as Mr. Mistoffelees and Paul Nicholas as Rum Tum Tugger cope adequately with the demands of the score, but they don't sing their parts with character and hence sound rather stilted. But nevertheless, most of the supporting cast members make up for these disappointments with crisp choral diction, even if their singing is a little laid back. The minor cats feature Myra Sands as a sprightly and no-nonsense Jennyanydots and Susan Jane Tanner as a soothing Jellylorum. Not to mention Bonnie Langford's lively portrayal of Rumpelteazer, and young Sarah Brightman's sweet, innocent and pure Jemima. Perhaps Jeff Shankley could be weak as Munkastrap here. And Stephen Tate makes a cameo appearance as a somewhat weak-voiced Gus: the Theatre Cat and Growltiger. The cast is ably supported by a firm hand in David Firman's direction of the orchestral accompaniments. It would be worth noting that this version of CATS is interesting in itself as a concept album. This is because the show underwent some extensive revisions for its Broadway premiere before the revisions were incorporated into all CATS productions worldwide. Almost the whole of the T.S. Eliot text is presented in this performance, with less verse cuts than the Broadway recording. In addition, you can also get to savour two draft versions of songs that were re-written. Mungojerrie and Rumpelteazer is given a jazzy setting which, in context, sounds a little stilted as compared to the jaunty music-hall setting written for Broadway. But, it is still interesting in itself. And so is the Ballad of Billy M'Caw, included during Growltiger's Last Stand. It may be more restrained than the Italian aria, but it still shows the character that Growltiger could have adopted if this song was retained. Other than these two notable drawing-board versions, the early drafts are minor, but still interesting. On the whole, I find this performance of CATS lacking in some sort of joie de vivre and spirit. Yet, for its historical value, I still recommend it, and makes a good alternative listening experience as compared to the Broadway cast. The packaging in a slimline double-disc jewel case includes a booklet with some production photographs from the London production, a cast list and a poorly-produced libretto in small print. There is also an abridged version of this recording (like the Broadway cast version has) that makes an ideal introduction to this recording in general, and it features the same selections as its Broadway counterpart. As an aside, this recording of CATS is not wholly complete, because it lacks The Battle of the Pekes and the Pollicles due to the need to accomodate space on record.
reviews.review_header: A weak yet acceptable official English CATS recording

reviews.review_text: Mom listens to this CD everyday. However Didn't realize it was not same vocals as the DVD.

I do not mean to ruffle anybody's feathers in my comments of this particular CATS recording, However, of all the official English-language recordings this recording sounds a little stilted and wanting in that littbe bit of energy. Part of it could be due to some of the performances, and part of it because this album uses the first version of CATS. Yet despite the lack of oomph, it is quite good and redeems itself by the aura it projects for being the world-premiere recording of the score. This recording features the Grizabella of Elaine Paige, who can be considered a true Grizabella in her own right. It's true that this early recording doesn't allow her to nuance the role as she did in the video, but she conveys a strength and vulnerability in her portrayal. Paige's rendition of Memory is solid, but at this early stage she had yet to mature into the role. I guess that it's also because this recording used the single version of the song, and that's probably why it sounds stilted. Brian Blessed partners her with his sincere and benevolent portrayal of Old Deuteronomy, and the rest of the performers fare quite well. However, I found Paul Nicholas as The Rum Tum Tugger to be somewhat wanting in energy. He fares a little better in his rendition of Mr. Mistoffelees, but doesn't smoke it out in his standout number. I think this is pretty much the case for most of the performers here, as the performances of the cast as a whole sound solid yet stilted at the same time. The orchestrations are less flashy and somewhat weak but you can hear the sort of sound that Lloyd-Webber originally intended for the musical, and the variants. Yes, this West End cast recording is like a concept album of sorts, staying closer to the T.S. Eliot cat poems without cutting verses as in later productions. The redeeming feature of this West End cast recording are the variants of numbers that were changed in lature productions. One variant, the duet for Mungojerrie and Rumpelteazer is set to an unvarying and jazzy melody that Lloyd-Webber replaced with the vaudeville-like version as heard on the Broadway video and in the video. The other variant is the duet for Growltiger and Griddlebone during Growltiger's Last Stand. Before this duet number was replaced with the better-fitting Puccini spoof, Growltiger and Griddlebone sang a rather unromantic drinking song about a musically talented parrot named Billy M'Caw. Even if Lloyd-Webber admits to preferring Billy M'Caw I tend to like the Puccini spoof a little better as it better integrates itself into the scene. For those who are used to the later versions of these numbers and to the beefed-up orchestration of the Broadway and video versions, this recording can offer a nice contrast. Yet in my view they have only made the rewrites and revisions that Lloyd-Webber added to the score for the rest of the productions much better. Despite my feelings, at least the aura of this recording is enough to save it from being stilted, despite the solid performances from everyone concerned. And besides, it includes extra verses that were cut for the Broadway and subsequent productions of the show, so it makes this album feel closer to the T.S. Eliot poems. It's good to see this recording in a reissue that treats it with respect. The 2 CDs come in a slimline double-disc case, packaged in a neat slipcase. The booklets are an improvement over those in the previous Polydor releases, as they have offered a better-print edition of the libretto and the production credits, including the musical numbers. However, I do admit that there isn't much of a difference in sound quality between this release and the original Polydor CD. The CDs appear to have been pressed from the original CD master rather than the better-sounding remastered version that was released in 1998. I know that if I were to recommend this West End cast recording I would recommend the 1998 remastered version, as it sounds less muffled compared to the sound on this release. Yet it would not be practical because that 1998 CD costs a whopping 65 dollars. In short, even if CATS fans covet this recording I'm sorry to say I don't covet it as much as they do. I acknowledge its strengths, but yet I know it sounds a little stilted on the whole. Even so, this recording redeems itself with its solid performance and the aura of it representing the first thoughts of Andrew Lloyd-Webber and staying close to T.S. Eliot's source material before the show was tweaked and altered for Broadway. But my first choice for a CATS recording still lies with the Broadway cast Cats: Complete Original Broadway Cast Recording (1982 Original Broadway Cast) as it's got this energy that makes the show work, without destroying its spirit and nature.
reviews.review_header: A rather weak CATS recording that has its own merits and aura

reviews.review_text: Get the 1985 Original Australian Cast instead. This very special recording is similar to the Broadway Version and the 1998 Film Version, but it's the only "complete" version, with all musical numbers, since it includes both "The Awefull Battle of the Pekes and the Pollicles" and the "Growltiger's Last Stand" (with "In Una Tepida Notte"). I should also say that Mungojerrie and Rumpleteazer sing the "new version" of their song, just like in the 1998 Movie Version. Besides, the cast is very talented, the sound quality is superior. That's the best version!!
The only version anyone should listen too. Broadway's version... well sucks ass.

I bought this to replace the old cassette version I had lying around, a soundtrack I hadn't listened to in years. It's interesting to listen to, compared with the cleaner Broadway version. Aside from lyrics and music they changed when they brought the show to the States, the musical direction has a quality that's closer to how it would sound in a live performance.
One of the original Webber productions!
I love it!! I will be lip sincing "Memories" for a talent show in a few months. I can hardly wait. So much fum

name: Late for the Sky Cat-Opoly

reviews.review_text: Great game! Item as expected. New condition. Such a fun game. Grandma loved it. Only downside is there's not a lot of money.

I brought this for a cat loving friend as a Christmas present. She howled when she opened package because she didn't expect to find this kind of gift. She waited til' her family members got together and she said they've been playing it nonstop. The best part to her was learning about the many different breed of cats. Great gift.
reviews.review_header: The best part to her was learning about the many different ...

reviews.review_text: I bought for my brother in law for christmas. He loved it, he is a huge cat fan. I am posting a photo he had posted of it. I am guessing he loved it, I thought it was adorable and very happy I found it. I recommend it, it is a wonderful gift for those cat loving friends.
reviews.review_header: He loved it, he is a huge cat fan

reviews.review_text: First of all...we love cats. Second of all, beyond that, this is exactly the same game of monopoly full of same strategies just all named differently. This past week we spent about ten hours playing two different games. We broke up the sessions and went swimming etc., then would be excited to come back to the game. It was me and two ten-year old twin boys. It keeps them off computer and us engaging, laughing and outwitting each other. I got to see how they think, how they plan, take risks, strategize, and make deals. It's a fascinating game that you will play for years and years.
reviews.review_header: Order Right Now. Best Game EVER!

reviews.review_text: If you like Monopoly and cats, this is the perfect game for you. I got it for my 10 year old son for Christmas. He is definitely a cat person and loves to study the breeds. We had a lot of fun playing it, though playing the full blown version is rather long for a 10 year old's attention span. Next time we'll do the shortened version. But it's very cute, from the tokens to the cat "properties" you land on and can buy.
reviews.review_header: Cute, fun for cat and monopoly lovers

reviews.review_text: Cat-Opoly! Come on - which meow hooman slave wouldn't love this? I'm not telling you what all of the pieces and properties are in case you'd like to be surprised, but suffice to say, they're wonderful. And as with any board game, the moment I have it opened up and all of the catnip in neat piles, the cats mysteriously appear and pounce into action as the tokens. The cats never go to jail, and they pass GO whenever the talon strikes!
reviews.review_header: Felinious fun furr all of the big cheeses at your lair

reviews.review_text: Great game, it is not for little ones without pretty good math and reasoning skills. It uses the same monetary denominations as real monopoly, instead of houses and hotels you buy litter boxes and scoops, and have to figure rent accordingly. Properties are different breeds of cats. It is very cute, but just know that really young kids would find it difficult. We still play it with my 6 y/o grandbaby. It just goes a little slower!
reviews.review_header: Great game, it is not for little ones without ...

reviews.review_text: Bought this to play on family game night, which consists of 2 adults and an 8 year old. As our son enjoys cats so much, I thought he'd be more inclined to enjoy the long game play required for any version of Monopoly, and the cute cats would lighten the mood. I was wrong.... It was worse. All the monopoly rage paired with the heartbreak of missing out on your favorite breed of cat. I enjoyed it a lot, if that counts for anything.

name: Cats: Original Cast Recording 1981 Original London Cast

reviews.review_text: This recording of CATS features the original London cast, headed by Elaine Paige and Brian Blessed. Because it is the first official full-length recording of CATS, this does not always mean that the world-premiere rendition is always the best. The London cast gives a fairly adequate performance of the score, and perform it with a softer-grained approach as compared to their Broadway counterparts. And the lean-textured recording has sounded even better than before with this recent digital remastering. Elaine Paige may be acknowledged as a foremost interpreter of Grizabella, but here her performance shows that she neds some time to get into the spirit of the role. She does give a fine rentition of Memory that, despite competition from Betty Buckley, allows her to hold her own. Brian Blessed gives a firm, commanding and sonorous portrayal of Old Deuteronomy. He has a convicting voice that he demonstrates to great effect in his solos, even in his powerful Ad-Dressing of Cats. The lower-level principals don't seem to fare that well. Wayne Sleep as Mr. Mistoffelees and Paul Nicholas as Rum Tum Tugger cope adequately with the demands of the score, but they don't sing their parts with character and hence sound rather stilted. But nevertheless, most of the supporting cast members make up for these disappointments with crisp choral diction, even if their singing is a little laid back. The minor cats feature Myra Sands as a sprightly and no-nonsense Jennyanydots and Susan Jane Tanner as a soothing Jellylorum. Not to mention Bonnie Langford's lively portrayal of Rumpelteazer, and young Sarah Brightman's sweet, innocent and pure Jemima. Perhaps Jeff Shankley could be weak as Munkastrap here. And Stephen Tate makes a cameo appearance as a somewhat weak-voiced Gus: the Theatre Cat and Growltiger. The cast is ably supported by a firm hand in David Firman's direction of the orchestral accompaniments. It would be worth noting that this version of CATS is interesting in itself as a concept album. This is because the show underwent some extensive revisions for its Broadway premiere before the revisions were incorporated into all CATS productions worldwide. Almost the whole of the T.S. Eliot text is presented in this performance, with less verse cuts than the Broadway recording. In addition, you can also get to savour two draft versions of songs that were re-written. Mungojerrie and Rumpelteazer is given a jazzy setting which, in context, sounds a little stilted as compared to the jaunty music-hall setting written for Broadway. But, it is still interesting in itself. And so is the Ballad of Billy M'Caw, included during Growltiger's Last Stand. It may be more restrained than the Italian aria, but it still shows the character that Growltiger could have adopted if this song was retained. Other than these two notable drawing-board versions, the early drafts are minor, but still interesting. On the whole, I find this performance of CATS lacking in some sort of joie de vivre and spirit. Yet, for its historical value, I still recommend it, and makes a good alternative listening experience as compared to the Broadway cast. The packaging in a slimline double-disc jewel case includes a booklet with some production photographs from the London production, a cast list and a poorly-produced libretto in small print. There is also an abridged version of this recording (like the Broadway cast version has) that makes an ideal introduction to this recording in general, and it features the same selections as its Broadway counterpart. As an aside, this recording of CATS is not wholly complete, because it lacks The Battle of the Pekes and the Pollicles due to the need to accomodate space on record.
reviews.review_header: A weak yet acceptable official English CATS recording

reviews.review_text: Mom listens to this CD everyday. However Didn't realize it was not same vocals as the DVD.

I do not mean to ruffle anybody's feathers in my comments of this particular CATS recording, However, of all the official English-language recordings this recording sounds a little stilted and wanting in that littbe bit of energy. Part of it could be due to some of the performances, and part of it because this album uses the first version of CATS. Yet despite the lack of oomph, it is quite good and redeems itself by the aura it projects for being the world-premiere recording of the score. This recording features the Grizabella of Elaine Paige, who can be considered a true Grizabella in her own right. It's true that this early recording doesn't allow her to nuance the role as she did in the video, but she conveys a strength and vulnerability in her portrayal. Paige's rendition of Memory is solid, but at this early stage she had yet to mature into the role. I guess that it's also because this recording used the single version of the song, and that's probably why it sounds stilted. Brian Blessed partners her with his sincere and benevolent portrayal of Old Deuteronomy, and the rest of the performers fare quite well. However, I found Paul Nicholas as The Rum Tum Tugger to be somewhat wanting in energy. He fares a little better in his rendition of Mr. Mistoffelees, but doesn't smoke it out in his standout number. I think this is pretty much the case for most of the performers here, as the performances of the cast as a whole sound solid yet stilted at the same time. The orchestrations are less flashy and somewhat weak but you can hear the sort of sound that Lloyd-Webber originally intended for the musical, and the variants. Yes, this West End cast recording is like a concept album of sorts, staying closer to the T.S. Eliot cat poems without cutting verses as in later productions. The redeeming feature of this West End cast recording are the variants of numbers that were changed in lature productions. One variant, the duet for Mungojerrie and Rumpelteazer is set to an unvarying and jazzy melody that Lloyd-Webber replaced with the vaudeville-like version as heard on the Broadway video and in the video. The other variant is the duet for Growltiger and Griddlebone during Growltiger's Last Stand. Before this duet number was replaced with the better-fitting Puccini spoof, Growltiger and Griddlebone sang a rather unromantic drinking song about a musically talented parrot named Billy M'Caw. Even if Lloyd-Webber admits to preferring Billy M'Caw I tend to like the Puccini spoof a little better as it better integrates itself into the scene. For those who are used to the later versions of these numbers and to the beefed-up orchestration of the Broadway and video versions, this recording can offer a nice contrast. Yet in my view they have only made the rewrites and revisions that Lloyd-Webber added to the score for the rest of the productions much better. Despite my feelings, at least the aura of this recording is enough to save it from being stilted, despite the solid performances from everyone concerned. And besides, it includes extra verses that were cut for the Broadway and subsequent productions of the show, so it makes this album feel closer to the T.S. Eliot poems. It's good to see this recording in a reissue that treats it with respect. The 2 CDs come in a slimline double-disc case, packaged in a neat slipcase. The booklets are an improvement over those in the previous Polydor releases, as they have offered a better-print edition of the libretto and the production credits, including the musical numbers. However, I do admit that there isn't much of a difference in sound quality between this release and the original Polydor CD. The CDs appear to have been pressed from the original CD master rather than the better-sounding remastered version that was released in 1998. I know that if I were to recommend this West End cast recording I would recommend the 1998 remastered version, as it sounds less muffled compared to the sound on this release. Yet it would not be practical because that 1998 CD costs a whopping 65 dollars. In short, even if CATS fans covet this recording I'm sorry to say I don't covet it as much as they do. I acknowledge its strengths, but yet I know it sounds a little stilted on the whole. Even so, this recording redeems itself with its solid performance and the aura of it representing the first thoughts of Andrew Lloyd-Webber and staying close to T.S. Eliot's source material before the show was tweaked and altered for Broadway. But my first choice for a CATS recording still lies with the Broadway cast Cats: Complete Original Broadway Cast Recording (1982 Original Broadway Cast) as it's got this energy that makes the show work, without destroying its spirit and nature.
reviews.review_header: A rather weak CATS recording that has its own merits and aura

reviews.review_text: Get the 1985 Original Australian Cast instead. This very special recording is similar to the Broadway Version and the 1998 Film Version, but it's the only "complete" version, with all musical numbers, since it includes both "The Awefull Battle of the Pekes and the Pollicles" and the "Growltiger's Last Stand" (with "In Una Tepida Notte"). I should also say that Mungojerrie and Rumpleteazer sing the "new version" of their song, just like in the 1998 Movie Version. Besides, the cast is very talented, the sound quality is superior. That's the best version!!
The only version anyone should listen too. Broadway's version... well sucks ass.

I bought this to replace the old cassette version I had lying around, a soundtrack I hadn't listened to in years. It's interesting to listen to, compared with the cleaner Broadway version. Aside from lyrics and music they changed when they brought the show to the States, the musical direction has a quality that's closer to how it would sound in a live performance.
One of the original Webber productions!
I love it!! I will be lip sincing "Memories" for a talent show in a few months. I can hardly wait. So much fum

I'm not knowledgeable enough to comment on most of the breeds but I do know the Siamese. The people do present a very accurate picture of the Siamese. I would just add, they will make you laugh. They will do something humorous to another cat, dog, or human and they will let you know so you can watch. They are incredible hunters who rarely miss. So if you let them out, prepare yourself for burial detail because they will bring it home, sometimes still alive, so that you can admire their prowess. Oh, and about the going outside, if they want out you will be in for a real battle of wits and my money is on the Siamese. On the down side, they are thieves we had one who had collected quite a few tennis balls. We didn't figure out where they were coming from until the town paper ran an article about the phantom cat snagging tennis balls in mid flight and taking off with them. I can attest to their protective streak. I had a medical emergency late one night, I did not know I was in trouble but somehow my Siamese did. He unlocked the bedroom door went downstairs and kept standing in front of the television yowling and then running to the stairs till my daughter got up to figure out why the cat was "acting like Lassie".
reviews.review_header: or human and they will let you know so you canwatch. They are incredible hunters who rarely miss

reviews.review_text: A video about the traits of full bred cats. I found it interesting but was expecting a video about how cats can be great companions, the psychological benefits for the owners. I had hoped it would be a video that promoted better care of cats, educating those who watch it, maybe some 'vet' input. I had adopted a cat with feline aids and really bonded with him while he lived with me for about 2 years. (He passed away) I still enjoyed this video but already knew about the breeds which is why I now have my first full bred cats, two Russian Blues.
reviews.review_header: Featuring the traits of each breed

reviews.review_text: There was no mention of the Noreign Forest Cat, a very large long haired cat the Vikings kept on their ships to control rodents. They are a very old breed with a thick undercoat to ptotect them from the cold. This breed is not as well known as the Main Coon which was also not mentioned.

It really does give very good insight into specific breeds. Not all are shown only the most popular cat breeds. It was filmed at a cat show behind the scenes but would of been very good to see how they are in normal family living homes. Thats why 4 stars only.
reviews.review_header: informative and just great to watch them play.

reviews.review_text: I am allergic to cats. This video rates the different cats breeds on how active they are and amount of maintenance needed. I was surprised that Siamese produce less dander than other breeds I may watch this video again to see what I missed that may be useful to me..
It was interesting to learn about the world of cats. They are truly amazing animals and I wanted to know more, especially about the two new Sphinx cats we now have in our family.

For those not familiar with the different breeds of cats, and wanting to get a quick introduction, this is a great source. The chart that rates the cats in the different categories is very handy, especially if you are trying to get a quiet cat for example. They also identify "dog-like behavior" in some breeds of cats which may be of interest to dog owners looking for a cat. Overall this is very nicely done as an introduction...
reviews.review_header: Great introduction to various cat breeds, nice charts

reviews.review_text: I have two domestic short hair cats (the most common breed) and nobody in the documentary talked about them..only fancy breeds.

name: Iams Weight Control Dry Cat Food

reviews.review_text: I like it, the cat is not so wild about it. This is exactly what the vet prescribed. The kitty is overweight but needs to keep some dry food in his diet. This product helps keep his weight down because he does not overeat.
My cat absolutely love this food she will only eat this little kibbled bite-size awesome. really looking forward to her losing weight
reviews.review_header: my cat LOVES Iams cat food weight loss

reviews.review_text: My cats won't eat it.
Too pricey for size of bag
Kitty is happy.
ok

My cat really likes this food and it keeps his weight healthy. I only give this a low rating because the ** bag arrived open and slightly spilled in the box**. I worried if the food was safe/secure. It was fine. My cat ate and enjoyed it safely. i will just buy this great product at the store.
reviews.review_header: It was fine. My cat ate and enjoyed it safely

reviews.review_text: • Iams Proactive Health Adult Weight Control Premium Cat Nutrition, 2.9 Pound. This veterinarian recommended cat food promises to provide healthy weight loss for your 1-6 year old adult cat. It will, its manufacturers state, provide high quality protein, while still offering great taste. It has 10% less fat than Iams Original. L-carnitine helps burn fat and build lean muscle. In addition, the kibble is enhanced with vitamins, minerals, fish oil and energy-boosting amino acids that should help your cat reach/maintain a healthy weight, with a healthy shiny coat. A tailored fiber blend, including probiotics and beet pulp should support healthy digestion; seven ingredients are targeted to help support a healthy heart. More health benefits include: enrichment with antioxidants to help support a strong immune system; high quality protein to help your cat maintain strong muscles and taurine for healthy eyes. The product is manufactured by a subsidiary of Proctor and Gamble that boasts 60 years’ experience, offers a rewards program, and is backed by a 100% guarantee. Well, the cats in this house, like the people, struggle with those few extra pounds, though, of course, they don’t know it. Except insofar as their diets are restricted. And poor DIvo, who at one time weighed a distinctly chubby 22 pounds; had to be kept on a tightly-restricted diet, three small meals a day of vet’s prescription food for many months to get him down to 16 pounds, moaned and groaned about it, too. Peachy, of a much quieter disposition, had doubled his weight in the year since I took him home from the pound. So: weight control for both of them; at any rate, it’s really very difficult to attempt to feed cats separately. They seem to like this kibble well-enough, however, gobble it down when presented for breakfast, lunch or dinner. They don’t seem to mind getting it for every meal. It’s really unfair, of course: I can enforce a strict diet on the cats, but not on my husband or, heaven forbid, me. Nevertheless, recommended.
reviews.review_header: They Gobble it Down at Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner
